I cannot allow this.

[From.GetFirstName]'s court was certainly charming, even moreso were [From.GetHerHis] promise of future support in the political matters. Your host is quick to lead you to the centre of the gazebo and stop the musician with a kind gesture, to call everyone's attention and formally propose to you. \n [From.GetFirstName] had already called a priestess for such an occasion and loses no time in asking her to perform the rite right there and then, so that you and [From.GetFirstName] may be joined forever.
O joyous day.

It seems [From.GetFirstName] is not willing to truly show [From.GetHerHis] love to you in a tangible way, providing presenting [From.GetHerHim]self as supportive in all matters to [From.GetHerHis] spouse-to-be. At this point you have no other choice but to refuse this foolish proposal entirely.
It was nonsense anyway.

You could understand if [From.GetFirstName] resisted to your courtship, but to attack you so abruptly? What a brutish thing to do. After all, what were you doing, if not celebrating [From.GetHerHis] beauty and virtue and what a fortunate union the one between you too would have been?
Maybe [From.GetSheHe]'ll change [From.GetHerHis] mind in a few centuries…

Unfortunately you had to be direct to convince [From.GetFirstName] of your refusal. This impoliteness to your host will certainly affect your reputation, but you are firmly sure it is the lesser evil.
It certainly is.

The treacherous snake. [From.GetFirstName] has not invited you with any kind thoughts in [From.GetHerHis] mind: this was nothing but a trap, a conceited attempt to publically shame you out of some preposterous claims.\n The host points at you, raising [From.GetHerHis] voice in [From.GetHerHis] pontification to catch as much attention as possible, but still without shouting nor veering from polite and sanctimonious reproace to gross vulgarity.\n To prevent disaster, you must fight at [From.GetHerHis] own game.
I shan't stand for this.
The filth in [From.GetHerHis] tongue spurs from the filth in [From.GetHerHis] soul.

Time and again, you expose the lackings of your opponent, weaving [From.GetHerHis] failures upon [From.GetHerHim] as a coat, for everyone to gaze upon them.\n Time and again, your opponent fights back, contesting your claims and making some of [From.GetHerHis] own. The discussion goes on for hours, as the public continues to enjoy the music and the wine, with its ears always focused on you.\n Then, finally, brought to exasperation by [From.GetFirstName]'s claims, you cannot refrain from directly swearing at [From.GetHerHim]. As [From.GetSheHe] smirks with satisfaction, you both realize [From.GetSheHe] has won.

Time and again, you defend against the preposterous accuses of your opponent, shaming [From.GetHerHis] conduct as a host and counterattacking with some insinuations of your own.\n Time and again, your opponent starts anew, skillfully defending against your quips. The discussion goes on for hours, as the public continues to enjoy the music and the wine, with its ears always focused on you.\n Then, finally, brought to exasperation by [From.GetFirstName]'s claims, you cannot refrain from directly swearing at [From.GetHerHim]. As [From.GetSheHe] smirks with satisfaction, you both realize [From.GetSheHe] has won.
Hmpfh, you worthless..!

[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] has been spending a lot of time celebrating you and your dynasty. For days now [From.GetSheHe] has talked to friends and acquaintaces about your great deeds and complimented your virtues with you in person.\n As [From.GetSheHe] goes on, [From.GetSheHe] doesn't shy away from trying to force out of you your opinion on some political issue [From.GetSheHe] seems to care very much about. At this point it would be incredibly rude to disagree.
And I will not.
But still I must.

[From.GetFirstName] could do nothing besides granting [From.GetHerHis] support after all you've said and done to stroke [From.GetHerHis] ego. It might have been somewhat debasing to spend so much time singing praises of someone else, but it served its purpose in the end.
It is an exercise in dialectic.

[From.GetFirstName] did not seem to get the tone of your music. Such a waste of time and reputation will come to nothing. You've spent days praising [From.GetHerHim] amongst friends and acquaintances, yet [From.GetSheHe] still refuses to return your kindness with a hand of friendship.
It is an exercise in dialectic at the very least...

[From.GetFirstName] has decided to divorce you. As the offended party, you can choose to demand compensation in the form of gold or land, if [From.GetSheHe] has any. If [From.GetFirstName] has not enough silver to pay you for, [From.GetFirstName] will receive a serious hit to [From.GetHerHis] reputation.
I don't really care, [From.GetSheHe] can go.
I'll demand monetary compensation.
I'll demand land from [From.GetHerHis] demesne.
[From.GetFirstName] has decided to allow the divorce proceedings to be completed without asking anything more than your part of the costs.
It was good while it lasted.

[From.GetFirstName] was very upset by your decision to divorce. If you wish for [From.GetHerHis] cohoperation, [From.GetSheHe] has set up a punitive compensation for [From.GetHerHis] broken feelings and loss of status.
Very well.
I don't have that kind of money.
[From.GetFirstName] has capitulated to your request. After everything has been signed, you're ready to say goodbye to [From.GetHerHim] forever.
And good riddance.
[From.GetFirstName] has refused to give in to your demands.
Just go away then.
Then guess what? No divorce!
[From.GetFirstName] did not take well at all your refuse and has decided to retort annulling completely the divorce proceedings. It seems you'll still be married for some time after all…
Curses.

[From.GetFirstName] was very upset by your decision to divorce. If you wish for [From.GetHerHis] cohoperation, [From.GetSheHe] has asked for you to give up to some of your demesne as a reparation for the damage caused by your hearthless soul.
As long as [From.GetSheHe] goes away…
I won't do that!
You've taken up the task of courting [From.GetFirstName], hopefully one day managing to take [From.GetHerHis] hand in marriage. How should you proceed next?
It seems [From.GetFirstName] has married another elf. Any other attempt at courship can certainly no longer taken in broad daylight.
This was a waste of time…
I'l just ask [From.GetHerHim].
A generous show of wealth will prove my commitment.
A generous show of power will prove my commitment.
There must be some other way…
You've taken up the task of courting [From.GetFirstName], hopefully one day managing to take [From.GetHerHis] hand in marriage. How should you proceed next?
I shall court [From.GetHerHim] with poetry.
I shall court [From.GetHerHim] with magic.
I shall court [From.GetHerHim] with passion.
There must be some other way…
You've taken up the task of courting [From.GetFirstName], hopefully one day managing to take [From.GetHerHis] hand in marriage. How should you proceed next?
I shall hunt rare games for [From.GetHerHim].
I shall gift [From.GetHerHim] the most precious items of my garden.
I will show [From.GetHerHim] exquisite pleasures such as [From.GetSheHe] has never seen.
I shall give [From.GetHerHim] access to my vast library.
[From.GetFirstName] has spent the past months drowning you in presents and gifts of all sorts, hoping to receive attention from you.
I do like presents…
What a waste of money.

You spent a lot on [From.GetFirstName] but it certainly seems [From.GetSheHe] appreciated many of your gifts. Showing to be a dependable partner is certainly fundamental to put the basis of a relationship.
Indeed.
Despite your efforts and expenses [From.GetFirstName] has not looked interested in any way to any of the presents you've riddled [From.GetHerHis] home in the past weeks.
Hmpf…

[From.GetFirstName] has tried many times in the past weeks to show off [From.GetHerHis] influence and power. You've had many acquaintances talk of [From.GetHerHim] in a throughly positive light and telling you what a wonderful spouse [From.GetSheHe]'d make.
That is true…
Not interested.

Your attempt at impressing [From.GetFirstName] has worked flawlessly: you had to call in several favors and subtly have your friends work their ways into [From.GetHerHis] circle of acquaintances to tell [From.GetHerHim] what a wonderful partner you'd make, but it was worth it.
Yes, it was.

Your attempt at impressing [From.GetFirstName] seems to have fallen flat: despite all the favors you had to call in from friends and relatives, nobody was able to convince [From.GetHerHim] of your good intentions and noble birth.
How unfortunate.
[From.GetFirstName] has sent you another poem. You've lost count by now of how many sweet words [From.GetSheHe] has written for you in delicate and moving style.
That is sweet.
How tedious.
You've spent weeks writing rhymes to [From.GetFirstName], and [From.GetSheHe] finally has started to mellow down on you. It was a lot of work, but you seem to have caught [From.GetHerHis] attention.
Outstanding.
All the sleepless nights spend writing poems to the sweet [From.GetFirstName] appear to have been for naught: [From.GetSheHe] remains cold to your delicate verses.
Hm…
From shows of light and illusions to work of art impossible to create for the most skilled craftsman, [From.GetFirstName] has given you quite a show of [From.GetHerHis] magical powers.
I'm impressed.
That's somewhat irresponsible.
[From.GetFirstName] has certainly been impressed by the spells and incantations you worked on for [From.GetHerHim], weaving wind after wind to catch [From.GetHerHis] attention.
Outstanding.
Not even the Winds of Magic seem to catch [From.GetFirstName]'s attention. Your many attempts at impress [From.GetHerHim] with your magic have come to nothing.
How can one not appreciate the Art!

[From.GetFirstName] has been cornering you at every occasion, whispering sweet nothings in your ear and leading you in the most compromising places. You've resisted [From.GetHerHis] advances until now, but is it really worth it?
Let's do this.
Maybe later on…
[From.GetFirstName] couldn't have resisted for much longer. You've used all your skills in the past weeks to charm and seduce [From.GetHerHim] and your effort has finally given its fruits.
Marvelous.
You've used all the tricks you had, but [From.GetFirstName] appears immune to your charms. Perhaps [From.GetSheHe]'s not really interested in the physical aspect of the future relationship.
What else then?

[From.GetFirstName] has sent you another exotic fur, fashioned after [From.GetHerHis] last kill. This suitor has spent the last week overflowing your home with trophies of [From.GetHerHis] hunts, all made in your honor, according to [From.GetHerHim].
It's beautiful.
So many wasted lives…

[From.GetFirstName] has been captivated by the trophies you've sent [From.GetHerHim] in the past days, result of your hard work in the wilderness. In fact, you've heard from multiple sources of [From.GetHerHim] wearing some of your furs in public.
Good.

[From.GetFirstName] has not even pretended to accept your last trophy, sending the fur back with a polite request to stop your endeavours in the wilderness. It seems like this is not something [From.GetSheHe]'s interested in.
I see…

Another ravishing bouquet has been sent by [From.GetFirstName]. There have been several in the past days, accompanied by invitations to [From.GetHerHis] villa as well. You're wondering if it would be proper to accept at this point…
It does look enchanted…
I have no time for this frivolousness.

[From.GetFirstName] has finally accepted your invitation to visit your gardens at the villa. You guide [From.GetHerHim] across the colorful landscape and soon captivate [From.GetHerHim] with the wonders you've grown within.
Excellent.

[From.GetFirstName] continues to ignore your floreal presents and the invitations to the villa. According to [From.GetHerHim] it is not a good period, but it might be that [From.GetSheHe] just doesn't like your flowers.
I should try something else.

More than once in the past weeks [From.GetFirstName] has managed to drag you into some obscene, wild party which has left you sickly and confused at every morning. At first it looked unbearable, but now you've starting to see how this kind of entertainment could be something of an acquired taste.
See you again tonight!
Enough of this.

You've managed to sneak [From.GetFirstName] into more than one wild party in the last few weeks. At first [From.GetSheHe] didn't seem to appreciate your companionship, but [From.GetSheHe] has since then started to like celebrating excess alongside you.
Yes!
You've attempted to sway [From.GetFirstName] with wild feasts and intoxicating philters, but [From.GetSheHe] doesn't seem interested in your kind of entertainment.
Drats.

[From.GetFirstName] is certainly meek for a suitor, if [From.GetSheHe] is a suitor at all. In the past week, [From.GetSheHe] has only been interested in spending time reading with you and talking about the ancient legends of your race.
It is all so interesting…
What a bore.
You've spent days with [From.GetFirstName], nosedived in old tomes and ancient scrolls, studying the history of your great heritage. There is so much you seem to have in common.
Did you read this one yet?

Your attempts at showing some ancient elven scrolls to [From.GetFirstName] have failed, no differently from many other similar gifts. It might be [From.GetSheHe] isn't very interested in ancient elven literature…
How can that be?
Before you make your proposal official, you should decide what kind of union are you hoping for.
A Regular Marriage.
A Matrilineal Marriage.
Even though you barely had time to truly know each other, [From.GetFirstName] has decided to propose [From.GetHerHim]self to you officially, hoping for a matrilineal union.
You've been courted by [From.GetFirstName] for some time, hence [From.GetHerHis] proposal of matrilineal marriage does not really come as a surprise to you.
Even though you barely had time to truly know each other, [From.GetFirstName] has decided to propose [From.GetHerHim]self to you officially, hoping for a regular union.
You've been courted by [From.GetFirstName] for some time, hence [From.GetHerHis] proposal of regular marriage does not really come as a surprise to you.
Before answering, I must consult my liege.
I could never disobey my liege.

[From.GetFirstName] was ready to accept your proposal. Not that there was ever any doubt about it: a courtier can hardly oppose the decision of [From.GetHerHis] rightful liege. A great ceremony will soon be held and the priestesses shall bind you in marriage, formalizing your union.
Excellent.

[FromFrom.GetFirstName] has come to you to inform you that [From.GetTitledFirstName] has formally proposed to [FromFrom.GetHerHim] and, as you are [FromFrom.GetHerHis] legal guardian, is coming to ask your permission to make this matrilineal marriage official.

Your suitor, [From.GetFirstName], has decided to propose formally to you, asking your hand in matrilineal marriage. The time has come to decide whether you want to spend the rest of your long life with [From.GetHerHim].

[FromFrom.GetFirstName] has come to you to inform you that [From.GetTitledFirstName] has formally proposed to [FromFrom.GetHerHim] and, as you are [FromFrom.GetHerHis] legal guardian, is coming to ask your permission to make this regular marriage official.

Your suitor, [From.GetFirstName], has decided to propose formally to you, asking your hand in regular marriage. The time has come to decide whether you want to spend the rest of your long life with [From.GetHerHim].
I accept.
I cannot allow it.
You are heartened to hear [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s answer to your proposal. A great ceremony will soon held to bind you and your newfound soulmate in marriage and formalize your union.
I'm so happy!
Sadly, [From.GetFirstName] doesn't seem to share your feelings for [From.GetHerHim] and has refused your proposal.
How could you?!

Many elves come to partecipate at your wedding ceremony, congratulating both with you and your spouse, discussing politics and listening to the soave music in the air. The priests of many gods have come to celebrate your union, bestowing bestowing blessings of fertility from Isha on the bride, auguries of fortune from Lileath, advices of steady conduct to please Asuryan, promises of riches from Vaul and predictions of long life from Morai-heg. Offerings are brought to each of the shrines as you walk by them and receive the gods' blessings, binding you each time further together.
And so we shall be.

The promise of life can only be bought by the certainty of death.\n You and your spouse raise the beating heart of the sacrifice to the shrine of Khaine and let it burn under the unforgiving gaze of the Lord of Murder, in the hopes it'll placate his thirst and allow your union to bear fruit. Only a few selected guests are honored with an invitation, dutifully kept afar and secretly watched by crossbowmen, ready to act at the first suspicious movement. Once the first ceremony is finally over, you leave the temple with your spouse, ready to make an ever more gruesome and enticing ritual to satisfy Atharti.
The gods watch us.

There is a time for everything. As you reach the spring of this cycle, you are united with your spouse, but, as all Asrai know, this time will someday pass and you shall be separated. In your marriage, you embody, in a small part, the sacred union of Isha and Kurnous and, like them and like all things, your happiness now will find balance in future sorrow. This is what the forest spirit remembers you as it gives its blessing and binds you together. Yet, as all cycles pass, you shall accept the nature of things with a light heart and do the best of what you have right now.
We will.
Since you're married already, it would not be appropriate to continue courting [From.GetFirstName].
It was fun while it lasted…

Many years ago another of your blood passed through the flames and was left burnt, you have dealt with the scorn of that legacy all your life. You never imagined you would get the chance to pass through the flames, but your emergence unscathed from the holy flame and subsequent coronation has caused your entire dynasty to be revaluated overnight! To wear the Phoenix Crown was legacy enough but you will undoubtedly be remembered as the greatest of your dynasty!
To the future of our family!
This bloodline will be added to all members of your dynasty currently living.

A dangerous horde of Beastmen has been flocking in [From.GetName]. The twisted Chaos creatures are being driven into a frenzy by their flea-ridden leaders and have taken arms to overcome the province.
They won't!
Once again the Corrupter has come back to life, once again hordes of Beastmen flock to his tattered banner, marching to destroy anything they find on their path.
They won't!
A rabid horde of Beastmen has emerged from the wilderness threatening to spoil and destroy anything they find on their path.
They won't!
The corrupting claw of the Shadowgave has touched this province, despoiling it of all that is orderly and natural.
Forrrwaarrrgdh!
The corrupting claw of the Shadowgave has touched [FromFrom.GetName], despoiling it of all that is orderly and natural.
Monsters!
The corrupting claw of the Shadowgave has touched [FromFrom.GetName], despoiling it of all that is orderly and natural.
Monsters!
[FromFrom.GetFirstName] has left these lands, migrating with [FromFrom.GetHerHis] warherd elsewhere.
Free!!
Warherd Rallied ( Beastmen )

Scourging and spoiling the land of [Root.Location.GetName] you've extended the fame of your Lord. More Beastmen gather around the ruins of the civilizations that once occupied this land, breeding and cursing the gods of Men and Elves.
Grrlooodhhh...

Scourging and spoiling the land of [From.Location.GetName] you've extended your fame as a Hordemaster. More Beastmen gather around the ruins of the civilizations that once occupied this land, breeding and cursing the gods of Men and Elves.
Grrlooodhhh...
Marshal Depletes Resources ( Beastmen )
The land of [Root.Location.GetName] is barren wasteland where nothing grows and no semblance of order remains and the herd is growing restless for new places to plunder and scourge.
Grmmpfh...
The land of [From.Location.GetName] is barren wasteland where nothing grows and no semblance of order remains and the herd is growing restless for new places to plunder and scourge.
Mroove the Hrrrdh!...
Krrpp heerre...
To the victor the spoils. The Beastmen follow the strongest and, by killing the previous leader, some herds are rallying under your banner.
[From.GetFirstName] has killed [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], one of your servants, and taken [From.GetHerHis] place as leader of the Warherd.
Hmpf.
With the death of [From.GetFirstName], you [From.GetHerHis] great horde is dividing, the various herds roaming on their own ways, seeking new places to pillage and spoil.
Overrrhh...
[From.GetFirstName] has challenged you in front of all your followers. You must defend your right to rule the Warherd.
Come heerrre!
Marshal Plunders and Increases Fame( Beastmen )
Scourging and spoiling the land of [Root.Location.GetName] you've extended the fame of your Lord. Civilization crumbles under the hooved steps of the blessed children of Chaos.
Scourging and spoiling the land of [From.Location.GetName] you've extended your fame as a Hordemaster. Civilization crumbles under the hooved steps of the blessed children of Chaos.
Grooodhh!...
Your Hordemaster stands before you, ready to defend [From.GetHerHis] right to rule.
Breaaahh!!
The Gods favour you! Their touch has given you clarity to see the Winds of magic.
Raaaahhh!!
The Gods have blessed your spawn. It shall grow to become a powerful shaman.
Grrlooodhhh...
This province is scourged by a massive Beastmen population. It is only right that your liege fund an expedition to cleanse it from these blasphemous monsters.
I will plead for it at once.
The land of [From.Location.GetName] is scourged by a massive Beastmen infestation. Your subjects have pleaded many times for you to fund an expedition to cleanse them.
Sounds reasonable.
We cannot spare anything for this.
Your soldiers did their job and exterminated every last one of the Beastmen still scourging your land.
Good.
The expedition had catastrophic results: not only the Beastmen repelled your forces, the battle has sent them into a frenzy, if they gain further momentum, they might turn into a full horde.
We must prepare ourselves!

The Ruinous Powers have touched you holding and their presence has been made apparent on your newborn [GetFromRelation]. The infant has come to life deformed, screeching from a beast's mouth. Many in your court demand for the creature to be burned immediately.

The gods have blessed your household, your newborn [GetFromRelation] shows their favour in [From.GetHerHis] proud animalistic features. Yet there are some in the court claiming the child's place is not in this world.
The child stays.
We'll leave it in the forest.
This thing will burn.
What shall be done with these prisoners?
The Hrrrd'stone! Brnng them to th'GODS!
Food fr hrrd.
Blah! Nothng.

You drag the tied up prisoner screaming in the middle of the herd, surrounded by the screaming jaws of your subjects. With a rough snap, you dig a bit in [From.GetHerHis] stomach. Feeling the metallic taste of blood sends you as well as the others into a frenzy and the whole pack leaps forward to devour [From.GetFirstName].
Braaarrkhh!
Your offering has pleased the gods. A small host of Beastmen, lured in by the lure of trophies and blood, has decided to join your herd.
Grood choisseh.
Your offering has pleased the gods. A large host of Beastmen, lured in by the promise of war and slaughter, has decided to join your herd.
Grood choisseh.
Your offering has pleased the gods. A band of trolls and giants have wandered into your domain and have found a temporary home around your herdstone, joining your herd.
The Godss arrre with uss!
The Gods did not favour you today. The stench of your offering has lured in a foreign herd, eager to claim your lands by force.
W'll frst upon thm!
You try to fall back and the enemy's blade strikes true. When you come to your senses again, you realize only a couple of stumps remain where your horns used to be.
Rrrgllhhh!
The weak inhabitants have risen up in [Root.GetName], led by a determined leader wanting to reclaim this land for their pitiable kind.
Nev'rrr!
The weak inhabitants have risen up in [From.GetName], led by a determined leader wanting to reclaim this land for their pitiable kind.
Nev'rrr!
The mere smell of blood can send you into a frenzy. You can hardly keep calm for an hour before your thoughts turn to violence and carnage.
Grrrrhh!
The little beast in your care grows angrier each day, [From.GetSheHe] is developing a true bloodlust.
Hmpf.
Almost everyone is stronger than you now, you've only found joy in tormenting and killing smaller animals. But one day...
Grrrrhh!
The little beast in your care is developing a petty and twisted mind, taking pleasure in everyone else's suffering.
Hmpf.
You despise being so weak and small, with no horns nor strength. You crave for the day you will be able to carve your place as rightful leader of a great herd.
Grrrrhh!
The little beast in your care is restless, violently trying to carve its place amongst the other children of [From.GetHerHis] age.
Hmpf.
Your natural inclination for violence has lately assumed a new flavour when you find yourself close to young people of the opposite gender, especially if they're beastmen like you.
Grrrrhh!

The little beast in your care has developed an insatiable lust, abusing other children whenever [From.GetSheHe] manages to subdue them or, if nothing else is available, spending hours humping trees and rocks.
Hmpf.
You are the ruler of a Bretonnian castle, and you - like the rest of your fellow rulers - are an ordained Knight of the Realm.

You are a skilled warrior, and it is time you took up your duties to the realm and became a Knight Errant of Bretonnia. It is your duty to seek out dangerous threats and conquer them in the name of the Lady.
You are a knight of Bretonnia, it is only fitting that you travel the land doing great deeds, rescuing maidens and slaying monsters. Will you take up the questing life?
I return home to heal - For the Lady!
You have become wounded, and can no longer carry on the questing life. It is time to return to your castle and regain your strength.

You are a knight of Bretonnia, but only the most noble and pure knights are worthy to sip from the Holy Grail of the Lady of the Lake. Do you want to test yourself on this great - but also dangerous, quest?
Simple peasants - so that's where my tax money went!

You come across a remote shrine, dedicated to a sighting of the Lady many years ago. Naturally you leave an offering to help maintain the shrine, but as you prepare to leave a local headman boldly asks you for a further donation to the help feed the local village.
Away with that, temptress! Just water for me from now on.
I could indulge myself just once more...

You are not the purest or most abstinent of knights, so life is a daily challenge to meet the lofty ideals you hold. One night you and your retinue arrive in a decent tavern to rest after your latest efforts, and soon after you take a seat a barmaid arrives to serve. Tired and deprived, you feel especially appreciative at the sight of the pitcher of wine balanced on her hip, and her warm inviting smile...
*restrain yourself* Be on your way, peasant...
I'll horsewhip you from here to Cathay, you foul peasant!

While passing through the countryside, you proceed past a filthy family of mud-scrabbling peasants. They drop their loads and fall to the ground with eyes averted as you pass by, but you can hardly believe it when one particularly malodorous one looks you directly in the eye!
Well met, Sir Knight! I am ready for the challenge!

You can't believe it... one day while riding in the woods, the Green Knight appears. This is the final test! If you prove worthy and defeat him, the Lady of the Lake will appear and allow you to sip from the Holy Grail!

It... it's finally happening! The Lady of the Lake appears before you, her grace and beauty beyond compare. Purified from your trials she allows you to sip from the Grail, and you feel vitality and strength flow into you!
You have become maimed, and can no longer carry on the questing life. It is time to return to your castle, and focus on strengthening your own lands with the rest of your strength.
I care nothing for what my vassals think!
Yes, I rule with the Lady's Blessing.
No, but I will continue questing for it!
I care nothing for what my vassals think!
Seven years have passed - have you become a Grail Knight?
Rumours reach you that the new ruler of Bretonnia has succeeded in the Grail Quest, and now rules with the blessing of the Lady of the Lake.

Rumours reach you that the new ruler of Bretonnia has failed in his Grail Quest, but has decided to rule on without the blessing of the Lady of the Lake. This is almost certain to start a civil war in that realm...
Rumours reach you that the new ruler of Bretonnia is having difficulty completing his grail quest, but is still determined to quest on until he succeeds.
No, I seek greater glories than mere trolls!

While searching for local challenges, you come across an unusual story. Sheep and peasants have gone missing, and despite repeated punishments the shepherds insist they are not lacking in their duties. They claim a foul beast, as tall as a house and reeking like a tannery lurks in the hills, periodically emerging to devour whatever it can catch. After some conference with your retainers you determine it could very well be a troll! Do you want to investigate?

It... it's finally happening! The Lady of the Lake appears before you, her grace and beauty beyond compare. She let's you sip from the grail, but it is not the invigorating and life changing experience you had heard it would be. But, surely you feel... something?
I... I think I feel a little more holy now?
It was the true holy grail, it must have been!
No, this isn't right. I must continue questing!
There have been some doubts cast on your vision of the Lady and the Holy Grail. You do not have the aura that other grail knights have, nor did the Green Knight appear to challenge you.
They weren't there - it happened! Maybe the Grail is simply different for each man?

Rumours reach you that the new ruler of Bretonnia has supposedly completed his grail quest, but there are doubts as to whether or not it was the real Grail. This will make his rule a troubled one, no doubt.

Several former Knight Errants have recently returned home after completing their questing duties, and they bring news most grave. Your child, [From.GetTitledFirstName], was killed by a group of beastmen during an extremely dangerous mission in southern Bretonnia. They assure you that [From.GetSheHe] faced the foul beasts with bravery and tried [From.GetHerHis] best before [From.GetSheHe] was killed by their overwhelming number.
My son... he died a hero...

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned from his quest as Knight Errant as a changed being. [From.GetSheHe] is more ambitious and more knowledgeable in matters of war. It seems the time spent as a Knight Errant did [From.GetHerHim] good.
Did you bring any riches home with you?

After many years in service, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has finally finshed his duties as a as Knight Errant and returned home. Your child is a changed being, however. [From.GetSheHe] now spends whole afternoons drinking, and stinks of ale, no longer listening to your fatherly advices.
I knew something bad was going to happen!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has finally returned home after a long and successful journey as Knight Errant! [From.GetSheHe] learned much from his battles against the enemies of the Lady and Bretonnia, alongside fellow knights!.
Tell me about your missions!
After many years in service, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has finally left the Fighter's Guild and returned home. Your child is a changed being, however. [From.GetSheHe] stinks of .
I knew something bad was going to happen!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned from his duties as a Knight Errant, but [From.GetSheHe] refuses to speak of [From.GetHerHis] experiences during them. You know [From.GetSheHe] took part in several battles and killed uncountable bandits, beastmen and orcs, but instead of reveling in the glory of [From.GetHerHis] accomplishments, [From.GetFirstName] is plagued by nightmares and jumps at sudden sounds.
Strange...
column3: Étrange...
column4: Seltsam...
column6: Extraño...

column2: A mysterious knight clad in strange armour approaches your throne, and before [From.GetSheHe] can be contained, the strange warrior relieves your guard of [From.GetHerHis] spear in a swift, fluid motion and tosses it aside. Other guards hurry forward, but you raise your hand to stop them. The stranger is [From.GetTitledFirstName], at last returned from his duties as Knight Errant!
[From.GetFirstName]! You've... changed!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has come back from his duties as Knight Errant, but [From.GetSheHe] is not alone. [From.GetSheHe] has saved a nobleborn lady during his quests and brought her with him. Though of a lesser noble bloodline, this woman seems to be of a perfect breed, a nice addition to our lineage!
To each [From.GetHerHis] own

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has at last returned from his Errantry Tour with a carriage filled with the spoils of [From.GetHerHis] quests! Apparently being a Knight Errant is very profitable business. Your child insists on sharing these riches with you, [From.GetHerHis] loving father.
[From.GetFirstName], you make me proud!

A frail, robed character is led into your throne room, and your guards explain that [From.GetSheHe] just arrived on a carriage. The character would only speak your name over and over again, and so [From.GetSheHe] was brought to you. To your horror, you recognize [From.GetHerHim] at last as [From.GetTitledFirstName]!
My son, what has happened to you!?

Upon learning of the death of your father, you left your Errantry Tour and departed for home on a carriage filled with gold from your glorious accomplishments. It was a long and perilous journey back, but your feet are now firmly planted on the soil of the land that is your birthright. The throne is yours.
It's a sad moment. But it's good to finally be back home.

Your child, [From.GetTitledFirstName], has decided to set out on an Errantry Tour in order to prove [From.GetHerHis] his honour as a true Bretonnian! Although [From.GetSheHe] will no doubt gain both glory and valuable battle experience as a Knight Errant, there will be many dangerous quests that could well cost [From.GetHerHis] life.
Go forth, son, for the Lady!
I will not allow it!

The camp was attacked last night. It seems the besieged are growing desperate with their tactics. Most of the men were caught by surprise but not you... you were not only ready to fight, but rallied some men around you and excelled during in combat. A deed worthy of a Knight of the Realm!
column3: Le camp a été attaqué la nuit dernière, lors d'une sortie désespérée des assiégés. De nombreux hommes furent pris par surprise, mais pas vous... vous étiez non seulement prêt à vous battre, mais vous avez également rallié quelques hommes autour de vous et avez excellé durant la bataille. Un chevalier offre de vous oindre sur le champ !
column6: El campamento fue atacado ayer por la noche en una salida desesperada de los sitiados. La mayoría de los hombres fueron cogidos por sorpresa, pero no tú... No sólo estabas presto a luchar, formaste con algunos hombres a tu alrededor y sobresaliste durante la batalla. ¡Uno de los caballeros se ofreció a ungirte en el acto!

column2: The enemy is flanking! You rallied some men around you and organized a great counter-charge, breaking the flanking enemies. A deed worthy of a Knight of the Realm!
column3: L'ennemi a tenté de vous prendre par les flancs. Vous avez rallié de nombreux hommes et avez excellé durant les combats. Un chevalier offre de vous oindre sur le champ !
column6: ¡Nos flanquean! Tras reunir a algunos hombres a tu alrededor y destacar durante los combates, uno de los caballeros se ofrece a ungirte en el acto!

column2: Finally, some recognition of my abilities. For the Lady and the King!
column3: Enfin un peu de reconnaissance pour mes capacités, je serai un fameux chevalier !
column6: ¡Al fin un reconocimiento de mis capacidades, seré un caballero famoso!

column2: May the Lady guide my path!
The Finals
You were able to make it into the finals. Although, the tournament and its ups and downs, you feel ready to win the whole thing!
I will be victorious!

You were able to make it into the finals. The tournament favourite [From.GetTitledFirstName] made it into the finals as expected. All eyes will be fixated on you and the monster they call [From.GetFirstNameWithNick].
Time to fight fate.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] dodged your strike and rushed in from the side. [From.GetTitledFirstName] managed to strike you with a swift and powerful blow.
I am hit.
That bastard managed to cut me.
I have been knocked off my horse.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] stops [From.GetHerHis] might stallion. You and [From.GetTitledFirstName] glare at each other for a good second. You both know that the next clash will be the determine the victor. Your horse's hooves glide through the sand and your grip tightens.

For sixty days, you and the greatest warriors of [TopLiege.Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] have been giving your all in the arena. Every melee you have won will mean nothing, if you were to fall right now. This one final clash will determine your position in the history books.

One on one, the stage is set, this is your moment.
The glory will be mine!
Final Showdown

It is time for the finals! Who will win the tournament?


[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], the overwhelming crowd favourite?
Or [From.GetTitledFirstName], the underdog who have been absolutely killing in the melee.

Place your bets now! Cheer for your champion! And please hold on to your hats!


Let the Finals Commence!
Bet on the favourite, [FromFrom.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Bet on the underdog, [From.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Cheer for [FromFrom.GetFirstNameWithNick]!
Cheer for [From.GetFirstNameWithNick]!
Just cheer on!
The Results
The final match was undoubtedly enjoyable and adding a little gambling to the mix made brought it to another level.
Money!
I am a great gambler.
Maybe I will win some money next time.
[From.GetTitledName] has been crowned the winner of the grand tournament.
[From.GetTitledName]'s bravery won [From.GetHerHim] second place in the grand tournament.
The ravens are ready to be sent forth notifying Knights and Lords alike of the Tourney of [Root.Capital.GetName]. How big shall this tourney be?
A small local tourney will suffice
A larger regional tourney
A grand tourney for all the realm!
I don't want to hold a tourney after all

[Root.GetTitledFirstName] [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName], I hereby invite you to participate in the tourney of [From.Capital.GetName], where the Knights residing near [From.Capital.GetName] shall test their mettle.

 Regards,
[From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], [From.GetTitle] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]

[Root.GetTitledFirstName] [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName], I hereby invite you to participate in the tourney of [From.Capital.GetName], where the best Knights and Lords of [tourney_kingdom.GetName] shall be invited to compete.

 Regards,
[From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], [From.GetTitle] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]

[Root.GetTitledFirstName] [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName], I hereby invite you to participate in the Grand Tourney of [From.Capital.GetName], where the the finest Knights and Lords of all the realm shall be invited to find out who is the most gallant and able knight in the land.

 Regards,
[From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], [From.GetTitle] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]
This is below me
column3: C'est au-dessous de mon niveau.
column6: Está por debajo de mi nivel.

column2: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] has been crowned the winner of [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s tournament.
column3: [FromFrom.GetTitle] [FromFrom.GetFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] a été couronné vainqueur du tournoi de [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName].
column6: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] ha sido coronodado vencedor del Torneo de [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName].

column2: A previously unknown hedge knight has been crowned the winner of my tourney, perhaps I should take him into my service?

column6: Un caballero errante hasta ahora desconocido ha sido coronado como el ganador de mi torneo, tal vez debería llevarlo a mi corte

column3: Un grand honneur m'a été accordé, [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] m'a choisie comme Reine d'Amour et de Beauté du Tournoi de [FromFrom.Capital.GetName] !

column6: Un competidor, mostrando su valentía en las listas, ha solicitado ser nombrado caballero, en reconocimiento.

So [FromFromFrom.GetSheHe] has decided to crown [FromFrom.GetFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] as [FromFromFrom.GetHerHis] Queen.

[FromFromFrom.GetSheHeCap] a décidé de couronner [FromFrom.GetFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] comme sa reine.
column6: [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] ha sido coronada Reina del Amor y la Belleza por el ganador del Torneo de [From.Capital.GetName]

column2: No, don't bother me about tourneys again!
column3: Non, ne me dérangez pas à nouveau à propos de tournois !

column2: [FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] truly deserves it!
column3: [FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] le mérite vraiment !

column2: During the tourney feasts [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] was heard to boast how many more jousts [From.GetSheHe] has won than you, and then went on to openly declare that [From.GetSheHe] would vanquish you in the lists, mocking your prowess all the while. Shall I let this stand?
column3: Durant le festin organisé pour le tournoi, [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] s'est vanté d'avoir remporté bien plus de titres que vous, puis [From.GetSheHe] a décrit comment [From.GetSheHe] vous vaincrait dans les lices lors de ce tournoi. Le laisserai-je faire?
column6: Durante las fiestas del torneo un compañero competidor se le oyó jactarse de cuantos títulos más ha ganado, a continuación, pasó a describir cómo te vencería en las listas. ¿Debo dejar que se ria sin más?

column2: [From.GetSheHeCap] merely jests
column3: Ce n'était que de simples plaisanteries.
column6: Él simplemente bromea

column2: I will show [From.GetHerHim]
column3: Je vais lui montrer.
column6: Yo le enseñaré

column2: That's it! I challenge you to single combat!
column3: Très bien ! Je vous défie en combat singulier !
column6: ¡Ya esta bien! ¡ Te desafio a un duelo!

column2: will become your rival
column3: va devenir votre rival
column6: se convertira en tu rival

column2: will be challenged to a duel
column3: va être défié en duel

column2: During the tourney feasts I was jesting with some companions about how I'd vanquish my opponents in the lists, particularly the inept [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]. [From.GetSheHeCap] did not seem happy with the goading, and appears to bear a grudge now...
column3: Durant le festin organisé pour le tournoi, j'ai plaisanté avec quelques compagnons sur la façon dont j'ai terrassé mes adversaires dans les lices, et particulièrement l'inepte [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]. [From.GetSheHeCap] semble avoir une dent contre moi maintenant...
column6: Durante las fiestas de torneo estaba bromeando con algunos compañeros sobre cómo me venzo a mis oponentes en las listas, sobre todo un caballero que tiene menos títulos que yo. Él parece guardar rencor ahora …

column2: I will dominate [From.GetHerHim]

column2: During the tourney feasts I was jesting with some companions about how I'd vanquish my opponents in the lists, particularly the inept [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]. After this goading, [From.GetSheHe] proceeded to walk calmly across the hall and threw [From.GetHerHis] glove full in my face, challenging me to single combat!
column3: Durant le festin organisé pour le tournoi, j'ai plaisanté avec quelques compagnons sur la façon dont j'ai terrassé mes adversaires dans les lices, et particulièrement [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] qui a moins de titres que moi. [From.GetSheHe] s'est levé et a traversé la grande salle avant de me jeter son gant au visage, me défiant en combat singulier !
column6: Durante las fiestas de torneo estaba bromeando con algunos compañeros sobre cómo me venzo a mis oponentes en las listas, particularmente [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] quien tiene menos títulos que yo. A continuación, caminó con calma a través del pasillo y lanzó su guante de lleno en mi cara, ¡me reto a un combate singular!

column2: I accept!

Vous pouviez lire l'affolement dans son regard avant qu'[From.GetSheHe] ne cède et vous fasse ses plus plates excuses pour ses calomnies.

column2: Good

column6: [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] acepto mi desafio a un duelo, y desgraciadamente me vencio. Quizas deberia haberme callado …

column2: The hall fell silent as [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s glove fell to the floor after he threw it square in [FromFrom.GetFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s face. The men say this was because of [FromFrom.GetFirstName]'s jests, the victor was unclear before the combatants were seperated.
column3: Un silence de mort s'est abattu sur la grande salle alors que le gant de [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] retombait à terre après avoir gifflé le visage de [FromFrom.GetFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName]. On dit que c'est à cause des plaisanteries de [FromFrom.GetFirstName]. Le duel qui s'ensuivit n'a pas réussi à départager les deux combattants.
column6: El silencio de apoderó de la sala cuando [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] retó a un duelo a  [FromFrom.GetFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName]. Los hombres dicen que esto fue debido a alas burlas de [FromFrom.GetFirstName], no quedó claro quien fue el vencedor del duelo antes de ser separados.

column2: The hall fell silent as [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s glove fell to the floor after he threw it square in [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s face. The men say this was because of [FromFrom.GetFirstName]'s jests, the result is [FromFrom.GetFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s victory in the ensuing duel.
column3: Un silence de mort s'est abattu sur la grande salle alors que le gant de [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] retombait à terre après avoir gifflé le visage de [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName]. On dit que c'est à cause des plaisanteries de [FromFrom.GetFirstName]. Le duel qui s'ensuivit a vu la victoire de [FromFrom.GetFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName].
column6: El silencio de apoderó de la sala cuando [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] retó a un duelo a  [FromFrom.GetFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName]. Los hombres dicen que esto fue debido a alas burlas de [FromFrom.GetFirstName], en el que en el duelo salio victorioso[FromFrom.GetFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName].

column2: During the post tourney celebrations I caught the gaze of my Queen of Love and Beauty, could it be that she desires me?
column3: Durant les célébrations qui ont suivi le tournoi, j'ai remarqué les regards que m'a lancé ma Reine d'Amour et de Beauté. Se pourrait-il qu'elle me désire ?
column6: Durante las celebraciones después de torneo capté la mirada de mi Reina del Amor y la Belleza, ¿puede ser que ella me desee?

column2: I shall pursue her
column3: Je vais lui faire des avances.
column6: Voy a intentarlo

column2: will respond to your advances
column3: va répondre à vos avances
column6: Le seguire el juego

column2: She's not for me
column3: Elle n'est pas pour moi.
column6: Ella no es para mi

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], the winner of the tourney and my champion, has been trying to seduce me all night. He did name me Queen of love and Beauty, perhaps we are meant for eachother?
column3: [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], le vainqueur du tournoi et mon champion, a tenté de me séduire durant une bonne partie de la nuit. Il m'a nommée Reine d'Amour et de Beauté, peut-être sommes nous faits l'un pour l'autre ?
column6: [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], el vencedor del torneo y mi campeón, ha intentado seducirme durante toda la noche. El me nombro Reina del Amor y la Belleza, ¿Quizas estemos destinados?

column2: Embrace the passion
column3: Embrassez la passion
column6: Abraza la pasión

column2: will be thrilled
column3: va être ravi
column6: estará encantado

column2: No thanks
column3: Non merci.
column6: No gracias.

column2: will be disappointed
column3: va être déçu
column6: será avergonzado

column2: After much flirting and merriment I have managed to seduce [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], my Queen of Love and Beauty. My tourney is complete!
column3: Après l'avoir courtisé et égayé pendant des heures je suis parvenu à séduire [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], ma Reine d'Amour et de Beauté. Mon tournoi est une totale réussite!

column2: Great!
column3: Génial !
column6: ¡Genial!

column2: Despite my best efforts at flirtation and seduction, [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], my Queen of Love and Beauty, has rejected my advancements.
column3: Malgré tous mes efforts pour la courtiser et la séduire, [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], ma Reine d'Amour et de Beauté, a repoussé mes avances.
column6: Despues de mis mejores trucos de flirteo, [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], mi Reina del Amor y la Belleza, ha rechazado mis cortejos.

column2: I'll have to find some wench then
column3: Je devrai chercher une autre jouvencelle dans ce cas.
column6: Voy a tener que encontrar alguna moza luego

column2: My liege, please choose a tier of tourney for which you would like to know of the medal winners
column3: Messire, choisissez s'il vous plaît une taille de tournoi pour lequel vous voudriez connaître les médailles des vainqueurs
column6: Mi señor, por favor elija un nivel de torneo para el que le gustaría saber de los ganadores de las medallas

column3: Grand Tournoi

column2: Regional Tourney
column3: Tournoi Régional

column3: Ici sont inscrites toutes les personnes vivantes ayant remporté une médaille les Grands Tournois de Westeros, où tous les chevaliers et les seigneurs sont invités.
column6: Aquí se enumeran todos los ganadores de las medallas vivos del Grandes Torneos de Poniente, donde se invita a todos los caballeros y señores del reino.

column2: Winners
column3: Vainqueurs
column6: Vencedores

column2: Runners-up

column6: Segunda plaza

column6: Tercera plaza

column6: Aquí se enumeran todos los ganadores de las medallas vivos de los Torneos locales

column2: Don't ask me about these small tournies again!
column3: Ne me dérangez plus à propos de ces petits tournois !
column6: ¡No me pregunte acerca de estos pequeños torneos de nuevo!

column2: Don't ask me about these type of tournies again!
column3: Ne me dérangez plus à propos de ce type de tournois !
column6: ¡No me pregunte acerca de este tipo de torneos de nuevo!

column2: You stumble out to the tourney grounds in a haze of ale, ready to face your next joust. You try to mount your horse, but trip and fall from the saddle. You begin to notice the eyes of the tourney-goers on you, and realize to your horror that you've forgotten to don your armor and most of your clothes.
column3: Vous vous sentez prêt à participez à votre prochaine joute. Vous empestez le vin et c'est en titubant que vous entrez sur le terrain. Vous essayez de monter sur votre cheval mais perdez l'équilibre avant de tomber de votre selle. Vous remarquez les regards de la foule et réalisez avec horreur que vous avez oublié de mettre votre armure et la plupart de vos vêtements.
column6: Llegas al a la lista empapado de cerveza, listo para enfrentar en la próxima justa. Intentas montar tu caballo, pero tropiezas y caes de la silla. Se empiezan a murmullos entre los asistentes, y te das cuenta con horror que se le ha olvidado ponerse su armadura y la mayor parte de su ropa.

column2: By the Lady, what was I thinking...
column3: Que les Dieux soient bons, à quoi pensais-je…
column6: Que los dioses sean buenos, en que estaba pensando …

column2: It is [From.GetBestName]'s turn to joust, but to the crowd's shock, [From.GetSheHe] stumbles out to the tourney field late and clearly drunk, with none of [From.GetHerHis] armor and only slightly more of [From.GetHerHis] clothing. [From.GetSheHeCap] tries to mount [From.GetHerHis] horse, but trips and falls comically to the ground, unable even to ride.
column3: C'est au tour de [From.GetBestName] d'entrer en lice, mais la foule est choquée. [From.GetSheHe] arrive en titubant sur le terrain et est clairement ivre. [From.GetSheHe] ne porte pas d'armure et a oublié de mettre la plupart de ses vêtements. [From.GetSheHeCap] essaye de monter sur son cheval, mais tombe immédiatement de selle.
column6: Es el turno de [From.GetBestName]para entrar en la liza, pero para sorpresa de la multitud, [From.GetSheHe] llega tarde y claramente borracho, con nada de [From.GetHerHis] armadura y algo de [From.GetHerHis] ropa. [From.GetSheHeCap] intenta montar [From.GetHerHis] caballo, pero se tambalea y cae al suelo.

column2: Ha! Now there's a [From.GetManWoman] who knows how to celebrate!
column3: Ha ! Voilà un(e) [From.GetManWoman] qui sait faire la fête !

column2: This is an outrage!
column3: C'est un outrage !
column6: ¡Esto es un ultrage!

column2: [From.GetBestName] was furious at your disrespect, and demanded that you be thrown out of the tournament!
column3: [From.GetBestName] était furieux(se) de votre manque de respect et a demandé à ce que vous soyez mis à la porte du tournoi !
column6: [From.GetBestName] estaba furioso por tu falta de respeto, y exigió que seas expulsado del torneo

column2: There'll be no glory for me this year.
column3: Il n'y aura pas de gloire pour moi cette année.
column6: No habrá gloria para mí este año.

column2: Fortunately, [From.GetBestName] found your drunken antics more amusing than insulting. You still had to drop out of the tournament, but [From.GetHerHis] approval softens the blow to your reputation, somewhat.
column3: Heureusement, [From.GetBestName] a trouvé vos cabrioles d'ivrogne plus amusantes qu'insultantes. Vous avez dû quitter le tournoi, mais son approbation a quelque peu atténué l'impact de cette frasque sur votre réputation.
column6: Afortunadamente, [From.GetBestName] hallo tus payasadas de borracho más divertido que insultantes. Fuiste expulsado del torneo, pero su aprobación ha mitigado un poco el impacto de esta broma a tu reputación.

column2: There'll be no glory for me this year.
column3: Il n'y aura pas de gloire pour moi cette année.
column6: No habrá gloria para mí este año.

column2: I will attend, It shall be entertaining!

column6: ¡Voy a asistir, Será divertido!

column2: I have better things to do than watch jousting

column6: Tengo cosas mejores que hacer

column6: ¡Gloria a la casa [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName]!

column6: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] obtuvo la tercera plaza en el torneo de  [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName].

column2: [FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] fought well

column6: [FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] lucho bien

column6: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] ha muerto tragicamente en el torneo de [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName].

column2: How unfortunate
column3: Quel malheur !
column6: Que mala suerte
