column6: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] ha sido mutilado horriblemente en las justas del torneo de [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName].

column2: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] has been badly wounded fighting in [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s tournament.
column3: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] a été sévèrement blessé lors d'un combat au tournoi de [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName].
column6: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] ha sido herido en las justas del torneo de [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName].

column2: After much food, wine, jousting and combat, [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s Tourney has finally ended.
column3: Après de nombreux festins, beuveries, joutes et combats, le Tournoi de [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] a finalement pris fin.
column6: Despues de mucha comida, vino, justas y combates, el torneo de [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]ha llegado a su fin.

column2: My squire deserves some credit
column3: Mon écuyer mérite un certain crédit.
column6: Mi escudero merece algo de crédito.

column2: Personally I blame my squire
column3: Personnellement, je blâme mon écuyer.
column6: Personalmente, culpo a mi escudero.

column2: It was a fine spectacle!
column3: Ce fut un beau spectacle !
column6: Fue un buen espectáculo

column2: My [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] has shown time and time again their skill at arms during the Tourney. Despite not winning, [From.GetSheHe] prevailed against many knights in the lists, covering [From.GetHerHim]self in glory.
column3: Mon(a) [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] a montré à de nombreuses reprises sa maîtrise des armes durant le Tournoi. Même s'[From.GetSheHe] n'a pas gagné, [From.GetSheHe] a battu de nombreux chevaliers dans les lices, se couvrant de gloire.
column6: Mi [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] ha demostrado una y otra vez su habilidad con las armas durante el torneo. A pesar de no haber ganado, pudo más que muchos caballeros en las listas, cubriendose a si mismo de gloria.

column2: This reflects well on me and House [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName]
column3: Cela rejaillit sur moi et sur la Maison [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName].
column6: Esto es buen reflejo de mí y de la Casa [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName]

column2: My [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] was paired with [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] in [From.GetHerHis] next joust. After many tilts and broken lances [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] was eventually unhorsed, leaving [From.GetTitledFirstName] to be declared the winner.
column3: Mon(a) [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] a affronté [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] lors de sa dernière joute. Après avoir brisé de nombreuses lances, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] a fini par être désarçonné, laissant [From.GetTitledFirstName] remporté la victoire.
column6: Mi [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] puede no haber ganado ninguno de los eventos cuerpo a cuerpo en el torneo pero [From.GetHerHis] destreza en las listas no pasó desapercibida.

column2: A good showing for House [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName]
column3: Une belle démonstration pour la Maison [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName].
column6: Una buena muestra de la casa [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName]

column2: My [GetFromFromRelation] [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] failed to display their full prowess during the Tourney. [FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] won a handful of tilts against lesser men, but was soundly beaten later on by a little known knight in one of the early rounds.
column3: Mon(a) [GetFromFromRelation] [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] n'a pas réussi à montrer l'étendue de ses talents lors du tournoi. [FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] a remporté de nombreuses passes contre des hommes de moindre envergure mais a été sèchement vaincu par un petit chevalier de peu de renom lors des premiers tours.
column6: Mi [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName]falló en mostrar toda su destreza durante el torneo. Ha ganado un puñado de combates contra hombres inferiores, pero fue derrotado profundamente en las listas posteriores.

column2: A poor showing for House [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName]
column3: Une bien piètre démonstration pour la Maison [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName].
column6: Una actuación pobre de la casa [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName]

column2: My [GetFromFromRelation] [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] was paired with [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] in [FromFrom.GetHerHis] next joust. After many tilts and broken lances [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] was eventually unhorsed, leaving [From.GetTitledFirstName] to be declared the winner. Your [GetFromFromRelation] has been eliminated as a result.
column3: Mon(a) [GetFromFromRelation] [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] a affronté [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] lors de sa dernière joute. Après avoir brisé de nombreuses lances, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] a fini par être désarçonné, laissant [From.GetTitledFirstName] remporté la victoire. Votre [GetFromFromRelation] a donc été éliminé.
column6: Mi [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] fue derrotado en las primeras rondas del torneo. Todavía podemos oír el desprecio de la multitud, despues de que fuera derrotado una y otra vez.

column2: Unlucky my dear [GetFromFromRelation]
column3: Quelle malchance mon cher [GetFromFromRelation]
column6: [From.GetSheHeCap] llevara la deshonra a la casa [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName].

column2: This is a great honour for our house
column3: C'est un grand honneur pour notre Maison.
column6: Es un gran honor para nuestra casa.

column2: The tourney had finally got underway, with the first day of the lists beginning in earnest. You failed to make it through undefeated however, and was unhorsed in a joust by [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], whose prowess was clearly greater. You have been eliminated from the tourney.
column3: Le tournoi a enfin commencé et la première journée est désormais terminée. Vous n'avez malheureusement pas réussi à créer l'exploit, vous avez été démonté par [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], dont les aptitudes étaient clairement supérieures aux votres. Vous avez été éliminé du tournoi.

column2: You were defeated by [This.GetTitledFirstName] [This.GetOnlyDynastyName]\n
column3: Vous avez été défait par [This.GetTitledFirstName] [This.GetOnlyDynastyName]\n

column2: I'll win next time
column3: Je gagnerai la prochaine fois.

column2: The first days jousting is complete, with many lesser riders having already been eliminated from the competition. Now over the coming days the remaining men shall compete in the final lists, tilting until only one champion remains.
column3: La première journée de joute est terminée et les cavaliers de moindre talent ont déjà été défaits. Demain les hommes toujours en course devront s'affonter dans les lices finales pour déterminer le champion.

column2: Fine jousters all of them
column3: Tous de fins jouteurs.

column2: After arriving in [From.Capital.GetName] the first day of the tourney began in earnest. You tilted against many lesser knights throughout the day, most of whom you unhorsed easily. Now in the coming days the final round of lists begins, and the opposition shall surely be more fierce.
column3: Après votre arrivée à [From.Capital.GetName] vous avez participé au premier jour du tournoi. Vous avez affronter de nombreux chevaliers de moindre talent que vous facilement démonté. Le dernier tour commence demain et les adversaires vont se sûrement être d'un tout autre niveau.

column2: I shall ready my horse
column3: Je dois préparer mon cheval.

column2: The tourney herald anounces the competitiors of the next joust, you have been drawn against [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]. You mount your charge, take a lance from your squire and ride to the end of the list as [From.GetTitledFirstName] does likewise. Then on queue the horses break into a gallop...
column3: Le héraut du tournoi annonce les compétiteurs pour la prochaine joute, vous avez été désigné pour affronter [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]. Vous vous équipez, demandez une lance à votre écuyer puis vous chevauchez jusqu'au bout de la lice tandis que [From.GetTitledFirstName] fait de même. Puis les chevaux se lancent au galop l'un contre l'autre...

column2: Steady...
column3: Maintenir…

column2: As you close in on your opponent you see an opening. You deftly guide your lance into strike whilst evading their charge...
column3: Alors que vous vous rapprochez de votre adversaire vous repérez une ouverture. Vous guidez adroitement votre lance pour frapper tout en évitant la charge de votre opposant…

column2: Hit!
column3: Touché !

column2: Your opponent got the better of you when you met in the centre of the lists. Your lance merely makes a glancing blow on their armour, whilst their lance hits true...
column3: Votre adversaire a su repérer une ouverture au moment où vous vous êtes rencontrés au centre de la lice. Votre lance a à peine égratigner son armure tandis que la sienne a visé juste…

column2: Oh dear
column3: Oh…

column2: Your opponent is unfortunately no longer available to joust.
column3: Votre adversaire n'est malheureusement plus en état de jouter.

column2: Fine, another then!
column3: Bien, un autre maintenant !

column2: The blow from [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s lance sends you reeling, and you struggle to stay on your horse. The crowd gasps, expecting you to fall. However you maintain your grip, bringing your mount around the other side of lists ready for another charge.
column3: Le coup porté par la lance de [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] vous a fait vacillé et vous luttez pour rester en selle. La foule retient son souffle, attendant que vous chutiez, mais vous parvenez à garder votre assise et replacez votre monture à l'autre bout de la lice, prêt pour une nouvelle charge.

column2: This time I'll strike
column3: Cette fois je vais frapper…

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] took the full force of your lance and was sent reeling, and only managed a glancing blow upon your own armour. [From.GetSheHeCap] almost fell off, but managed to regain [From.GetHerHis] balance and round the other end of the lists ready for another tilt.
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] a encaissé votre violent coup de lance et vacille, tandis qu'il n'est parvenu qu'à égratigner votre armure. [From.GetSheHeCap] a failli tomber de cheval, mais est parvenu à récupérer son assise avant de se diriger vers le bout de la lice, prêt pour une nouvelle joute.

column2: I'll knock [From.GetHerHim] off this time
column3: Cette fois, je vais le heurter violemment.

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s lance strikes you square in the middle of your breastplate, exploding into many pieces as it hits. The force knocks the wind out of you and sends you flying from your horse. You are left lying in the dirt defeated as the crowd cheers [From.GetTitledFirstName].
column3: La lance de [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] vous a touché en plein milieu de votre pectoral avant de se briser en plusieurs morceaux. La violence du coup vous a propulsé loin de votre cheval. Vous gisez dans la boue tandis que la foule acclame [From.GetTitledFirstName].

column2: Ouch
column3: Ouch

column2: You expertly struck [From.GetTitledFirstName] with your lance right in the middle of [From.GetHerHis] breastplate, causing your lance to shatter into a thousand pieces as [From.GetSheHe] is sent flying from the saddle. The crowd gives a great cheer at your victory, and is relieved to see [From.GetTitledFirstName] is unharmed.
column3: Vous avez frappé [From.GetTitledFirstName] avec précision, en plein milieu de son pectoral. Votre lance s'est brisée en mille morceaux et a propulsé votre adversaire à plusieurs mètres de là. La foule vous acclame et est soulagé de constater que [From.GetTitledFirstName] n'est pas blessé.

column2: A fine hit I must say
column3: Un joli coup je dois dire.

column2: You and [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] collide fiercely, both lances shattering in a hail of splinters. You both ride on still ahorse to the other end of the lists to take a new lance from a squire. You notice [From.GetTitledFirstName] is now bleeding profusely from a wound, but [From.GetSheHe] urges [From.GetHerHis] mount on for another charge regardless.
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] et vous-même entrez violemment en collision, vos deux lances explosent en mille morceaux. Toujours à cheval, vous vous dirigez tout deux vers vos écuyers pour récupérer une nouvelle lance. Vous remarquez que [From.GetTitledFirstName] saigne désormais abondamment d'une blessure, mais [From.GetSheHe] ne semble pas s'en soucier et presse sa monture pour une nouvelle charge.

column2: This will give me an advantage
column3: Cela va me donner un avantage.

column2: As you and [From.GetTitledFirstName] meet you both score a good hit, both lances shattering as you both ride on still mounted. You are hit with a sudden bout of pain however as you realise you are now bleeding profusely. You take up a new lance from your squire anyway and charge gamely on.
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] et vous même parvenez à délivrer une belle frappe, vos lances ont explosé mais vous êtes parvenu tout deux à rester en selle. Cependant vous ressentez tout à coup une douleur soudaine et réalisez que vous saignez abondamment. Sans vous en soucier outre mesure, vous demandez une nouvelle lance à votre écuyer et reprenez votre place pour une nouvelle charge.

column2: This will not stop me
column3: Cela ne va pas m'arrêter.

column2: You are helpless as [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s lance forcefully knocks of your saddle and into the air. You land with a sickening crunch into the dirt, the pain is immense, you are sure something is broken...
column3: Vous vous sentez impuissant au moment où la lance de [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] vous touche avec violence et vous jette à bas de votre selle. Vous vous écrasez par terre, la douleur est immense, vous êtes sûr que quelque chose s'est brisé...

column2: Arrrggghhh!!!
column3: Arrrggghhh!!!

column2: The hapless [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] has no chance as [From.GetSheHe] is sent flying by your ruthless strike of the lance. [From.GetSheHeCap] lands in the dirt with a sickening crunch at an awkward angle, and as a squire rushes to [From.GetHerHis] aid the crowd goes silent goes silent as they realise the seriousness of [From.GetHerHis] injuries.
column3: Le malchanceux [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] a été propulsé loin de sa monture par votre violent coup de lance. [From.GetSheHeCap] s'est écrasé par terre et vous avez nettement entendu un craquement. Un écuyer s'est précipité pour l'aider et la foule garde le silence, réalisant la gravité de ses blessures.

column2: So, I win then?
column3: Alors, j'ai gagné non ?

column2: You know this is not right, you cannot land a blow on [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], whilst the point of [From.GetHerHis] lance is aimed true on you. As it strikes, the last thing you feel is the lance slipping between a gap in your armour, impaling you...
column3: Vous savez que ce n'est pas bon. Vous n'arrivez pas à maintenir votre lance dans la direction de [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], tandis que la pointe de la sienne fonce droit sur vous. La dernière chose que vous ressentez est une intense douleur au moment du choc. La lance a touché une des articulations de votre armure et pénètre votre chair...

column2: Arrrggghhh!!!
column3: Arrrggghhh!!!

column2: At first you were pleased to land a hit, however the poin of your lance found a gap in [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s armour, impaling [From.GetHerHim] in a gruesome fashion. As people rush to [From.GetHerHis] aid, it becomes obvious there is nothing that can be done for [From.GetHerHim] as [From.GetHerHis] lifeblood spills onto the dirt.
column3: Au départ vous étiez heureux d'avoir touché, puis vous vous êtes rendu compte que la pointe de votre lance avait rencontré un point faible de l'armure de [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] qui a fini empalé. Alors que tout le monde se précipite pour l'aider, il est devenu clair que rien ne pourra le sauver.

column2: How unfortunate
column3: Quel malheur !

column2: You have been declared the winner, defeating [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] in a fine joust.
column3: Vous avez été déclaré vainqueur, battant [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] lors d'une bonne joute.

column2: None can beat me
column3: Personne ne peut me battre.

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] has been declared the winner, defeating you and eliminating you from the tourney.
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] a été déclaré vainqueur, vous ayant défait et éliminé du tournoi.

column2: There is always next time
column3: La prochaine fois !

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] and [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] were the next to joust in the lists. After many tilts and broken lances [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] was eventually unhorsed, leaving [From.GetTitledFirstName] to be declared the winner.
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] et [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] étaient les prochains à se rencontrer dans les lices. Après avoir brisé de nombreuses lances, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] a fini par être démonté et [From.GetTitledFirstName] a été déclaré vainqueur.

column2: Well done, a fine joust!
column3: Une belle joute !

column2: After many tilts over several days only two knights remained undefeated. [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] and [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] faced eachother in the final joust, and after many tilts of finely executed jousting [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] was unhorsed, leaving [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] to be declared the winner of the tourney.
column3: Après de très nombreuses joutes, seuls deux chevaliers sont restés invaincus. [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] et [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] se sont rencontrés lors de la dernière joute et après de nombreuses et belles charges [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] a été démonté et [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] a été déclaré vainqueur du tournoi.

column2: A worthy champion
column3: Un digne champion.

column2: I will watch every tilt!
column3: Je vais aller voir toutes les joutes !

column2: Maybe some coin can persuade [From.GetHerHim] to fall?
column3: Peut-être que quelques pièces pourraient le(a) persuader de tomber ?

column2: You have been drawn against [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] in the next joust, and [From.GetSheHe] is desperate to win it seems. [From.GetSheHeCap] has offered you a fine purse of coin to throw the tilt and let [From.GetHerHim] win.
column3: Vous avez été désigné pour affronter [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] lors de la prochaine joute et [From.GetSheHe] semble avoir peu d'espoir de gagner. [From.GetSheHeCap] vous a offert une belle bourse pour perdre la joute et le laisser gagner.

column2: A fair deal, I shall fall at the first tilt
column3: Une belle affaire, je vais tomebr lors de la première charge.

column2: This is dishonourable bribery!
column3: Quelle ignoble pratique !

column2: When [From.GetSheHe] heard of your bribe, [From.GetTitledFirstName] feigned disgust and reluctance at first, but this was clearly a face saving act. [From.GetSheHeCap] eventually accepted your coin, and will now throw the joust at the first tilt.
column3: Lorsqu'[From.GetSheHe] a entendu parlé de votre offre, [From.GetTitledFirstName] a d'abord feint d'être dégouté et de vouloir refusé, mais il s'agissait clairement d'un jeu pour sauver la face. [From.GetSheHeCap] a fini par accepter votre argent et va perdre la joute lors de la première charge.

column2: Everyone wins
column3: Tout le monde gagne.

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] was outraged at your attempted bribe, [From.GetSheHe] called it a slight on [From.GetHerHis] honour and rejected it out of hand. [From.GetSheHeCap] vows to beat you on lists fairly.
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] a été choqué par votre tentative de corruption, [From.GetSheHe] a refusé d'entacher son honneur et à rejeter votre offre. [From.GetSheHeCap] veut désormais vous battre sur la lice.

column2: [From.GetSheHeCap] values honour too much
column3: [From.GetSheHeCap] fait bien trop de cas de son honneur.

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s aim is poor, but you casually shift your body in the way so you catch a mild blow from it. You throw yourself from the horse, adding some theatrics to make it look convincing, and in doing so losing the joust.
column3: Le coup porté par [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] est très faible et mal ajusté mais vous parvenez à vous positionner de façon à le recevoir sur votre pectoral. Vous sautez de cheval tout en ajoutant un peu de comédie pour que le coup paraisse convaincant. Vous avez perdu la joute.

column2: A well earned purse
column3: Une bourse bien gagnée.

column2: You casually aim your lance in [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s general direction, sure of a strike in any case. [From.GetTitledFirstName] duly gets in the way and takes a mild blow, theatrically falling from [From.GetHerHis] horse to make a convincing show of it.
column3: Vous tendez votre lance comme vous le pouvez en direction de [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], sûr que vous allez le toucher. [From.GetTitledFirstName] parvient à se positionner de façon à prendre le coup puis chute en ajoutant assez de comédié pour que l'affaire pariasse convaincante.

column2: A win is a win
column3: Une victoire est une victoire.

column2: Whilst perparing for the tourney a young peasant boy has taken to helping with your horse and armour. You're not quite sure where he came from and how he came to start helping you, but he seems an earnest lad and eager to help. Perhaps he would make a good squire?
column3: Alors que vous vous prépariez pour le tournoi, un jeune paysan vous a proposé de vous aider avec votre armure et votre monture. Vous ne savez pas trop d'où il vient et pourquoi il veut vous aider. Peut-être qu'il pourrait faire un bon écuyer ?

column2: Yes, I'll take him on
column3: Oui, je vais le prendre.

column2: I won't have some common urchin helping me, be gone!
column3: Je ne vais pas prendre un gamin du commun comme écuyer, déguerpis !

column2: I've been helping [Root.Guardian.GetTitledFirstName] in the tourney as [Root.Guardian.GetHerHis] squire, and at the end of the days jousting me and some other squires found a lot of wine! We shared it with some serving girls and had a great time, but the next morning has come and now I feel terrible.
column3: J'ai aidé [Root.Guardian.GetTitledFirstName] au tournoi en qualité d'écuyer. Hier soir, après les joutes, j'ai trouvé, avec d'autres écuyers, plusieurs bouteilles de vin ! Nous l'avons partagé avec quelques servantes et nous avons passé du bon temps. Mais ce matin je me sens très mal.

column2: I hope [Root.Guardian.GetTitledFirstName] wont be mad
column3: J'espère que [Root.Guardian.GetTitledFirstName] ne sera pas en colère.

column2: The days jousting is about to begin, and you realise your squire [From.GetTitledFirstName] is horribly hungover. You learn that [From.GetSheHe] and some other squires found a cask of wine and shared it with some serving girls, and got very drunk. His support as a squire in the lists will surely suffer.
column3: La journée de joute est sur le point de commencer et vous réalisez que votre écuyer [From.GetTitledFirstName] a une terrible gueule de bois. Vous apprenez qu'[From.GetSheHe] a découvert, avec d'autres ecuyers, quelques bouteilles de vin qu'ils ont partagé avec de jeunes servantes. [From.GetSheHeCap] risque d'avoir du mal à vous aider dans les lices.

column2: Ha! The young lad is growing up!
column3: Ha ! Ce petit jeune est entrain de grandir !

column2: I shall lecture him about his duty as a squire
column3: Je vais le sermonner sur ses devoirs en tant qu'ecuyer.

column2: Right, he has earned a good beating!
column3: Bien, il a mérité une vonne taloche !

column2: Whilst preparing for the tourney you and your squire have been training hard. You have been instructing him in the art of wielding a lance and riding a horse. There have also been intense sparring sessions, and he has been made to understand what his duties in the lists are.
column3: Lors de la préparation pour le tournoi, vous et votre écuyer vous êtes durement entrainés. Vous lui avez appris à manier la lance et à monter un cheval. Vous l'avez aussi entrainé au combat et il semble avoir compris ce qu'il doit faire dans les lices.

column2: He seems ready to assist me in the lists
column3: Il semble prêt à m'aider dans les lices.

column2: Whilst preparing for the tourney, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has found time to fit in training for you. [From.GetSheHeCap] has been instructing you in the proper use of a lance, and has been given you intense sparring sessions. Your duties as a squire in the lists have also been made absolutely clear.
column3: Lors de la préparation pour le tournoi, [From.GetTitledFirstName] a trouvé du temps pour vous entrainer. [From.GetSheHeCap] vous a instruit dans l'art du combat et de la lance. Vos devoirs dans les lices en tant qu'écuyer sont désormais tout à fait clairs.

column2: I am a good squire!
column3: Je suis un bon écuyer !

column2: The Everchosen is the champion of all four Chaos Gods. You can journey to the Altar of Ultimate Darkness in distant Naggaroth to seek the favour of the Chaos Gods. The stronger the Winds of Chaos are, the more likely they are to give you their mark.
I wonder how strong the Winds of Chaos are...
You make your way across the wastes, into the northern limits of Naggaroth, where stories tell of the Altar of Ultimate Darkness. Finally, after many trials, you reach your destination...
Yes, I will march alongside the Everchosen!
No, I will never march with that fool.
An Everchosen has been selected, and a great war is being prepared. Daemons of the Dark Gods march under their banner - surely you yourself should also march to war alongside this new champion?
Yes, I will face their terror even so!
No, perhaps now is not the time...
The Winds of Chaos are weak at the moment, and the Ruinous Powers are unlikely to grant you their blessing. Do you still wish to proceed?
Yes, I will face their terror even so!
No, perhaps now is not the time...
The Winds of Chaos are only moderately strong at the moment, and the Ruinous Powers are less likely to grant you their blessing. Do you still wish to proceed?
No, perhaps now is not the time...
The Winds of Chaos are  strong at the moment, and the Ruinous Powers are likely to grant you their blessing. Do you wish to proceed?
No, perhaps now is not the time...
The Winds of Chaos are very strong at the moment, and the Ruinous Powers are almost certain to grant you their blessing if you pass their trials. Do you wish to proceed?
I will prove myself worthy - charge!

Upon entering the temple you are beset by nightmarish visions, testing your faith to its very core. Your mind is strong enough to persevere, and finally you come to the test... you must defeat the Champion of the Gods to receive their mark!
Urrrghh! No... not ... like this!

Upon entering the temple you are beset by nightmarish visions, and attacked by daemons of all sorts! You cannot hold on, the Gods are displeased at your trespass, and soon you are surrounded fighting desperately for your life!

You have won the duel against the champion, and you finally kneel before the Altar of Ultimate Darkness, and receive the mark of the Dark Gods. 'Rise... Everchosen... and conquer in our name' a terrible unison of four voices growls in your head...
Let all bow before the Everchosen!

You return to your lands, bearing the mark of the Gods. Across the wastes, word spreads like wildfire: An Everchosen has been selected, and armies of daemons march by [From.GetHerHis] side! They would be fools not to join you now in the coming war...
After enduring the aches and pains of your body for what seems an eternity	The Gods have have decided reward you for perseverance. You even feel more alive than you ever did before!

The Beastmen hate Mankind with a deep loathing born of uncounted centuries of battle and righteous persecution. They seek a return to that primeval age when Man was little more than prey to be hunted and devoured, where the Beastmen were considered the true masters of the world. The lands you've taken must be destroyed!

You could have sworn you had a holding here, but there's nothing left. As you wonder what could have happened, you spot the fortress flying over your head with wings of stone before disappearing in the distance.

[From.GetFirstName] is bound and dragged to the centre of the summoning circle while you start chanting the spell. What daemon should you call forth from the Warp to inhabit [From.GetHerHis] body and devour [From.GetHerHis] soul?
I call forth a Flamer of Tzeentch!
I call forth a Plaguebearer of Nurgle!
I call forth a Daemonette of Slaanesh!
I call forth a Bloodletter of Khorne!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has dragged you in [From.GetHerHis] summoning circle to perform some dark ritual, but at the last moment you manage to break free of your boundaries and interrupt the ritual. In the backlash of magical fires, you sneak out of the room, fleeing from your captor.
That was close.

Just a few words before the ritual is complete, [From.GetFirstName] manages to get free of [From.GetHerHis] boundaries, interrupting the ritual. Even worse, the backlash of the broken spell creates enough of a distraction to allow the prisoner to escape.
Gahhh!!!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has dragged you in [From.GetHerHis] summoning circle to perform some dark ritual, but after the spell has been completed, something seem to go wrong. You feel something crawling inside you, but your body cannot handle the stress and you explode all over the room.
It would seem the recipient was not appropriate. The spell somehow fails and the prisoner explodes into a bloody pulp.
Just... fetch me some new clothes.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has dragged you in [From.GetHerHis] summoning circle to perform some dark ritual. A long series of incomprehensible words are spouted and some blood is spilled and finally a small portal opens and something slips through and crawls inside you.
Nnnhghgnnnhh!!!

The summoning is a success: the body of the prisoner starts twisting and burning as the Flamer reshapes it in a cacophony of discordant voices and writhing colours. Yet, something went wrong with the wards. The daemon slips away right after inhabiting the body, free to roam the world unbound.
Curses! So close.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has dragged you in [From.GetHerHis] summoning circle to perform some dark ritual. A long series of incomprehensible words are spouted and some blood is spilled and finally a small portal opens and something slips through and crawls inside you.
Nnnhghgnnnhh!!!

The summoning is a success: the body of the prisoner starts twisting and burning as the Flamer reshapes it in a cacophony of discordant voices and writhing colours. The wards bound the creature, who awaits for your commands.
Good.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has dragged you in [From.GetHerHis] summoning circle to perform some dark ritual. A long series of incomprehensible words are spouted and some blood is spilled and finally a small portal opens and something slips through and crawls inside you.
Nnnhghgnnnhh!!

The summoning is a success: the body of the prisoner starts bloating and decaying as the Plaguebearer reshapes it in a flurry of rupturing boils and swarming vermin. Yet, something went wrong with the wards. The daemon slips away right after inhabiting the body, free to roam the world unbound.
Curses! So close.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has dragged you in [From.GetHerHis] summoning circle to perform some dark ritual. A long series of incomprehensible words are spouted and some blood is spilled and finally a small portal opens and something slips through and crawls inside you.
Nnnhghgnnnhh!!

The summoning is a success: the body of the prisoner starts bloating and decaying as the Plaguebearer reshapes it in a flurry of rupturing boils and swarming vermin. The wards bound the creature, who awaits for your commands.
Good.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has dragged you in [From.GetHerHis] summoning circle to perform some dark ritual. A long series of incomprehensible words are spouted and some blood is spilled and finally a small portal opens and something slips through and crawls inside you.
Nnnhghgnnnhh!!

The summoning is a success: the body of the prisoner starts writhing and twisting as the Daemonette reshapes it in a storm of flesh and desire. Yet, something went wrong with the wards. The daemon slips away right after inhabiting the body, free to roam the world unbound.
Curses! So close.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has dragged you in [From.GetHerHis] summoning circle to perform some dark ritual. A long series of incomprehensible words are spouted and some blood is spilled and finally a small portal opens and something slips through and crawls inside you.
Nnnhghgnnnhh!!

The summoning is a success: the body of the prisoner starts writhing and twisting as the Daemonette reshapes it in a storm of flesh and desire. The wards bound the creature, who awaits for your commands.
Good.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has dragged you in [From.GetHerHis] summoning circle to perform some dark ritual. A long series of incomprehensible words are spouted and some blood is spilled and finally a small portal opens and something slips through and crawls inside you.
Nnnhghgnnnhh!!

The summoning is a success: the body of the prisoner starts tearing itself apart as the Bloodletter reshapes it in a wave of bone and blood. Yet, something went wrong with the wards. The daemon slips away right after inhabiting the body, free to roam the world unbound.
Curses! So close.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has dragged you in [From.GetHerHis] summoning circle to perform some dark ritual. A long series of incomprehensible words are spouted and some blood is spilled and finally a small portal opens and something slips through and crawls inside you.
Nnnhghgnnnhh!!

The summoning is a success: the body of the prisoner starts tearing itself apart as the Bloodletter reshapes it in a wave of bone and blood. The wards bound the creature, who awaits for your commands.
Good.
You've prepared the summoning circle and all the needed materials to temporarily open a portal to the Warp and summon a daemon into this world. Which creature should you call?
I call forth a Flamer of Tzeentch!
I call forth a Plaguebearer of Nurgle!
I call forth a Daemonette of Slaanesh!
I call forth a Bloodletter of Khorne!
I call forth a K'daai of Hashut!

Despite your best efforts, the circle was not strong enough to contain the eldritch energies of the Chaos Realm. The Warp breaks through and a host of cavorting daemons drags you with them to meet their masters.
Noooooo!!!
The Flamer slowly takes form before you, a collection of mouths and gooey limbs spitting fire and steaming ichor. The circle holds and the daemon is yours to command.
I am your Master now.

The Plaguebearer slowly takes form before you, a humanoid creature with rotten skin, skinny limbs and a bloated belly filled with worms and decayed entrails. The circle holds and the daemon is yours to command.
I am your Master now.
The Daemonette slowly takes form before you, an alluring androgynous creature with pale, silken skin bounded by hard chitin. The circle holds and the daemon is yours to command.
I am your Master now.
The Bloodletter slowly takes form before you, a screaming red-skinned monster eager for battle.  The circle holds and the daemon is yours to command.
I am your Master now.
There's a creature of one of my Master's enemies in this land. I cannot tolerate it!
Die!
We are many and our Master is one. It's time to drag the wizard to our home.
Yessss.

In your pride you thought the host of daemons in your service would be easy to control. But you were wrong: the creature of the Warp have banded against you and, easily overcoming your powers, they drag you screaming into the Realm of the Dark Gods.
Noooooo!!!
A ravenous Bloodletter of Khorne has come to you, offering you promises of future conquests and victories and standing ready to do your bidding. Or so it says.
A decayed Plaguebearer of Nurgle has come to you, offering its eternal love and plenty of gifts from its Dark Master.
A luscious Daemonette of Slaanesh has come to you, offering you to lead you through uncharted heights of pleasure and joy. Or so she claims.
A raving Flamer of Tzeentch has come to you, offering you the power of the endless fires of the Changer of Ways.
A searing K'daai of Hashut has come to you, offering you the might and riches of the Bullfather's forges.
I am your Master now.
I don't need you.
Daemon Hunt
There is a nefarious presence plaguing this province. A daemonic being might be at work.
It won't hide for longer...
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has tracked down a daemon hiding in your lands. The Witch Hunter is certain of the existence of the creature and requires your support to trap and cleanse it.
Yes, destroy it!
We have other things to worry about...
You've received support from your liege and are ready to spring the trap on the daemon and cleanse the land from its evil influence.
Let us proceed.

The creature of Chaos revealed itself to be stronger than the Witch Hunter's faith. [From.GetFirstName]'s remains were found scattered in the main square, alongside the entrails of the soldiers you provided [From.GetHerHim] with. There is no trace of the beast.
The gods protect us!

A nosy Witch Hunter has managed to find out about your familiar. The daemon revealed itself to be more cunning than [From.GetHerHim] and managed to kill [From.GetHerHim], but it was also put on the run, rescinding the contract which was binding it to you.
Damnations!
The accursed mortals have managed to trap you. You fight for as long as you can, but the Witch Hunters are finally able to send you screaming back to the Chaos Realm.
Grreeaaaahhhh!!!
An accursed Witch Hunter, [FromFrom.GetFirstName] has managed to trap and destroy your familiar. Luckly for now, the connection between the two of you remains hidden.
Damnations!

After the cleansing of the daemon, you've spent a lot of time trying to figure out who the wicked creature of darkness was serving and you've finally concluded it must have been [From.GetTitledFirstName].
No one can escape the righteous wrath of Sigmar.
The Witch Hunter [From.GetFirstName] has managed to rally some ridiculous sort of "proof" regarding you consorting with daemons and demands now your confession.
*Appeal to liege*
*Banish the Witch Hunter*
*Imprison the Witch Hunter*
[From.GetTitledFirstName] stands accused, by [FromFrom.GetFirstName], on charges of consorting with daemons.
Burn [From.GetHerHim]!
This is just posturing!
Throw [From.GetHerHim] in the darkest dungeon!
Papa Nurgle has brought forth good tidings and plentiful bounties for all the good people in the world. Today its servant has decided to honour you.
Ugh...
[From.GetFirstName] craves to see what your worth is or spill your blood for Khorne. Would you accept the daemon's challenge and fight with it?
Let's fight!
You're beneath me.
The fight goes on until the daemon is prone on the ground, leaking ichor from numerous wounds. You're tired, but you've learned something more about battle.
This is your place, vermin.
You try your best, but nobody ends the fight as victor. Even worse, the Bloodletter manages to sink its claws deep in your flesh a couple of times.
Grrnnhhh...
Despite your efforts, the daemon swiftly overcomes your defences and tears your body apart, leaving you near-dead on the ground.
Gllfgrrnnthh...
You push the daemon back time and again and such is your display of violence that you feel the gaze of Khorne bearing upon you, granting your body new strength.
Victory!
Your Master seems a little lonely. Maybe the mortal would like to spend some quality time with you?
HmmmHmm...
[From.GetFirstName] awaits you inside your rooms. The daemonette lures you in your bed, whispering honeyed words and promising you to unravel secrets from beyond the veil, if only you'd let her.
Yes, please!
Maybe another time...
The lips of the daemon feel cold at the first kiss, but they quickly gain an exotic and irresistible flavour. And at every new taste of her, you feel as if your mind is opening to new horizons.
More, more!...
Enough!
The whispers within your mind are getting louder. There is no doubt something else has found home within your body and is now struggling to wrestle its control from you.
Never!

Your blood boils to the point of burning your flesh from the inside out. The daemon inside you keeps on tearing at your soul, taking away whatever is left of your consciousness, until your body has been completely transfigured and there is nothing left of you inside it.

One malady after the other, the daemon has completely devastated your body, to the point you yourself can barely recognize it. In the unimaginable suffering you are submitted to by your flesh slowly rotting away and worms feeding off your entrails, you finally accept the daemon's welcoming embrace to oblivion.

No mortal indulgence can satiate your cravings any more. The burning desire instilled by the daemon is too much to bear, and it finally breaks your mind entirely as the daemon starts feasting on your soul, one delicious piece at a time.
More and more mutations wreck your body, repurposing it to the daemon's whims. At every change, you lose another part of yourself, until there's finally nothing left but the unholy creature.
BLOOD AND SKULLS!!!
The Great Father watches over you...
Time for some *real* fun!
Krlleeaaaach!!!
A never-ending rage burns through your body. You cannot rest, you cannot sleep, even the slightest wrong sends you into a roaring rampage.
Blood! BLOOOD!!!
You tighten your hold on the courtier's neck, your vision blurred by rage. You don't know who that is or what he did to you, you only know that you won't find peace until you've disembowelled him.
Die! Die! DIE!!!
People feel safe in passing their titles to their children. They grow lazy heirs. Worthless! The only right by blood is the one gained by spilling that of your enemies!
Only the strongest rule!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has issued a declaration regarding all [From.GetHerHis] vassals: from this day forward, all of your lands will be inherited only by those who show themselves worthy of them by testing their mettle in battle.
Hmm...
You first started just to crave more from your favourite sex, but now your lust has grown insatiable. Men, women, children... Nothing can sate your appetites any longer.
More! More!

You pin the courtier on the wall and start tearing apart their clothes with inhuman strength. Your vision is blurred and you've yet to realize if you caught a man or a woman, but that surprise will be part of the fun when you slam yourself on them and start having your way with them.
No, no, don't keep quiet! I liked you screaming...

You crawl on the table, reaching for another plate further away from your reach. You've not stopped eating since morning, but the more the pain in your stomach grows, the more you feel compelled stuffing it more.
Glmmglrrghh...

You've nearly turned blind with the last barrel of wine and cannot stand on your feet any longer, but you still crawl to the next. You've lost your chalice, therefore you just hug the cask and start suckling from it.
Glglglgllglh...
Why do you have to be bothered entertaining all those ugly, old harpies? From now on, only young and beautiful men shall be allowed in your realm.
Why do you have to have only ugly, old men as your servant? From now on, only young and beautiful women shall be allowed in your realm.
Now we'll finally have someone interesting around here...
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decreed that henceforth only men will hold any position of worth inside [From.GetHerHis] realm.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decreed that henceforth only women will hold any position of worth inside [From.GetHerHis] realm.
Hmm...
You sneeze once more a copious amount of snot dropping on your chest and dripping all over your clothes.
Bleah...
Scores of boils have appeared all over your body, another of the charming gifts bestowed upon you by the daemon inside you.
Ggghhh...
A terrible fever has struck you, weakening your body and giving you horrible visions of the Realms of Chaos.
Ggghhh...

You can barely sleep any longer. You can feel the presence of the daemon inside you, whispering, pulling your flesh from the inside, turning it into something monstrous. You can see every little detail of your body which is slowly changing, while being unable to do anything about it.
No, no, no!
To each his own, and to everyone something. Your realm will be better off with the lands and title divided unevenly between all. It's certain to create a lot of interesting situations.
Indeed!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decreed all lands to be split on death of their possessor between all of their heirs, with the main beneficiary being the one with the most support.
Hmm...
Control is but an illusion, why pretend it to exist in the first place?
No more!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decreed all laws of the realm to be null and void. Only the rule of the strong and cunning will determine the loyalty of the servants towards the masters.
Hmm...
Everybody expect the firstborn to be the favourite, everybody grooms him to be the best. It is the turn of the youngest now!
Truly!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decreed that enceforth all lands shall be inherited by the youngest sons and daughters of the realm and no longer the eldest.
Hmm...

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has managed to ambush you with the help of a few guards and is now starting to recite some ominous spell while the others bind you. The chanting goes on for hours, until finally you feel the daemon being torn from you with excruciating resistance and be banished into the warp.
Aaaarrgghh!!

Luckly you manage to ambush [From.GetFirstName] with the help of a few guards and start reciting the exorcism as they bind [From.GetHerHim]. The chanting goes on for hours, until finally you see the daemon being torn from [From.GetHerHis] with excruciating resistance and be banished into the warp.
Praised be [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has managed to ambush you with the help of a few guards and is now starting to recite some ominous spell while the others bind you. The chanting goes on for hours, until finally you feel the daemon being torn from you with excruciating resistance and be banished into the warp.
Aaaarrgghh!!
You can feel it now: the daemon leaving you was nothing but an illusion! The presence has resurfaced again, gnawing at your soul!
Not again!
It would seem your spell did not in fact succeeded in freeing [From.GetTitledFirstName] from the evil presence hiding inside [From.GetHerHim].
Curses.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has managed to ambush you with the help of a few guards and is now starting to recite some ominous spell while the others bind you. The chanting goes on for hours, but the daemon has sunk its teeth inside you and doesn't let the body go without dragging your soul away as well.
Aaaarrgghh!!

While the exorcism started for the better, the daemon did not leave its host without consequences: the foul creature dragged away the soul of [From.GetTitledFirstName], leaving an empty and lifeless shell behind.
Curses.

The daemon struggles as the last shred of life leaves your body. The welcoming cold of death is a balm for your mind and you can only laugh at the now-desperate attempts of the ethereal creature to hold onto you.
No soul left to eat. Time to leave, pathetic creature!

You cannot rest, nightmares of lightning and blood tear your mind every time you try to sleep.
'YOU DARE TO CLAIM BLOOD AND GLORY WITH COWARDLY MEANS?! HOW CAN YOU KEEP DISHONORING YOURSELF WITH MAGIC!?!.'
In every dream the great armoured hound looks down upon you from his throne, berating and belittling you.
'I HAVE NO USE FOR WEAKLINGS AND DECEIVERS!'
Continue.
Then take away the stain of magic, Lord of Skulls, so that I may serve you better!

Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] has requested you to prepare a summoning circle, for [From.GetSheHe] desires for you to call a daemon from the Realms of Chaos and bind the creature into [From.GetHerHis] service.
Very well, I shall do it.
No. It's not worth the risk.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has refused your request, pointing you out the dangers of opening a portal to the Realm of Chaos.
Hmpf.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has accepted your requests. When the fateful night comes, [From.GetSheHe] prepares the summoning circle and all the needed ingredients and, with you at [From.GetHerHis] side, starts chanting the summoning spell that will bring a daemon into your world.
You are not sure of what is happening until too late: the ritual has failed. A host of terrifying daemons break through the summoning circle to drag you and the sorcerer into the Realms of Chaos.
Noooooo!!!
Your ritual for [From.GetFirstName] was a success. You've managed to bind a raving Flamer to [From.GetHerHim].
Excellent.
Your ritual for [From.GetFirstName] was a success. You've managed to bind a decomposing Plaguebearer to [From.GetHerHim].
Excellent.
Your ritual for [From.GetFirstName] was a success. You've managed to bind an alluring Daemonette to [From.GetHerHim].
Excellent.
Your ritual for [From.GetFirstName] was a success. You've managed to bind a brutal Bloodletter to [From.GetHerHim].
Excellent.
The Blood God watches over you from his throne of skulls. What is your offer?
The greatest pyre to ever burn!
A great offering, so that he might remember me.
A large offering, so that he might notice me.
A small offering, to show my loyalty.
The Lord of Skulls is pleased with your offering. With a flash of fire and a burst of blood, a daemonic apparition floats down from the sky, allowing you to pick a boon of your choosing.
Some of your warriors, to crush my enemies!
Fill me with your strength!
Fill me with your energy!
The Lord of Skulls must be pleased with you, for after you offering has been burned, a daemonic creature tears its way into reality to offer its services to you.
You'll follow my orders from now on!
The Blood God favours you. As your offering burns, you feel yourself filling with unholy rage.
Raaaahhhh!!
The ground cracks and a great river of blood bursts forth to cover you and your followers. Clearly the Lord of Skulls looks you favourably.
Yes!
The Blood God favours you. As your offering burns, you feel yourself filling with rage.
Raaaahhhh!!
The smoke of your offering creates intricate designs, you can see the grand design of your patron, finally.
Yes!
Despite your effort, the Lord of Skulls has not reacted to your offering. Perhaps you've not given enough to satiate his thirst.
Grmmmh...
Papa Nurgle is always ready to dispense his gifts to all who are in need. All the same, he's happy to receive offering from his own followers.
The greatest pyre to ever burn!
A great offering, so that he might remember me.
A large offering, so that he might notice me.
A small offering, to show my loyalty.
The smoke of your offering covers the field with a noxious fog and a jolly voice resonates in your ears, thanking you for your gift and asking to pick a boon of your choosing in return.
I wish to receive magic, to better spread your gifts!
I wish my servants to love me as I love you!
I wish to share your gifts with all of my servants!
Papa Nurgle must be really pleased with you, for after you offering has been burned, a daemonic creature claws out of the ground, ready to hug and serve you.
I'm so happy to meet you, friend!
As your offering burns, you feel the love of Nurgle filling your heart.
Why can't we just all get along?
The smoke of your offering covers the field with a noxious green fog, undoubtedly proving the Lord of the Flies' unconditional love for you.
I love you!
As your offering burns, you feel Nurgle's generosity filling your heart.
Let everyone share in his gifts!
The fumes of the pyre fill your lungs and you can see the marvellous future the Lord of Flies has in store for you.
I'm coming Papa!
Papa Nurgle has certainly accepted your present, but it could be that others are in greater need of his gifts than you.
Don't worry, I'll wait for next time.
The Serpent always thirsts for more delights and greedily takes anything which is offered up. What will you offer Slaanesh?
The greatest pyre to ever burn!
A great offering, so that he might remember me.
A large offering, so that he might notice me.
A small offering, to show my loyalty.

The Dark Prince's voice resonates in your mind, you can feel his touch crawling beneath your skin. Your offering has momentarily pleased your Master, to the point they'll grant you a gift of your choice.
Grant me mastery over the Winds of Chaos.
Make me beautiful.
Heal my body so that I may be whole again!

One of the bodies on the pyre stands up and shakes off the flames, shambling away from the others. As it moves, the flesh crawls and flickers and when it reaches you, you realize it is a daemon, a gift from the Dark Prince.
Let us know each other, yes?
Like a beacon, the pyre draws a black pegasus to the field. The wild creature descends upon you and bows at your feet, clearly a gift from the Serpent.
How about turning around now?
The Dark Prince's voice resonates in your mind, you can feel his touch crawling beneath your skin. The Serpent's sweet words clearly show you must be amongst his favourites.
Never doubted it.
As the flames burn on the pyre, so too does a new lust inflame your soul, rekindled by the Dark Prince's touch.
Hmm...
The bodies on the pyre create the most interesting shapes while they burn. You can see the artistry of your Master behind them.
Yes... yes it is so clear!
You've waited until the last embers have gone cold, but there has been no response from your Master. The Dark Prince must have a poor disposition today.
Rats.
The Changer of Ways is fickle in his rewards and greedy in his requests. What shall you give to him?
The greatest pyre to ever burn!
A great offering, so that he might remember me.
A large offering, so that he might notice me.
A small offering, to show my loyalty.
Motes of unnatural light dance over the pyre and you can feel the Architect of Fate is looking at you, ready to grant your heart's desire.
Magic! Grant me the true power of Chaos!
Knowledge!
More power!
One of the bodies on the pyre explodes in a shower of gore. The melted remains come together into an unnatural shrieking mix, a daemonic gift from your Master.
I am your Master now.
As the smoke rises, you can feel the touch of Tzeentch upon you. The Changer of Ways has given you his greatest gift: magic.
Power over reality.
The shining smokes and twisting flames undoubtedly show the favour of your patron.
Good.
The Architect of Fate has looked at your offer and filled your mind with new and greater plans for you.
Yes, there's greatness in store for me!
The Architect of Fate has looked at your offer and filled your mind with new and greater plans for you.
Yes, there's greatness in store for me!
The Great Plotter's plan is yet to be uncovered. Nothing happened after your offering was sent.
Next time... next time...
The Gods blessed you on the fields of battle today. Your patron's eye is looking right inside your soul.
I am victorious!
Only the best survive the endless trials of the gods. You are more than all the others, you are a true champion of your patron.
Glorious.
There is no doubt your god has something special in mind for you. You have received many gifts and have ascended as a chosen servant of your deity.
I shall be eternal!

The time has come. You've endured hardship, you've survived all of your patron's generous gifts, you've outdone the efforts of others to please your deity, and he has finally rewarded you with the ultimate gift: you leave your old husk and in a storm of twisting bone and melding flesh you achieve apotheosis and are reborn as an immortal Daemon Prince.
Reaaaahhh!!

[From.GetFirstName] struggles desperately within your clutches, but it's too late for [From.GetHerHim]. You open your jaws and suck [From.GetHerHis] delicious soul from the pathetic husk, feasting upon [From.GetHerHis] essence.
Marvellous.
The terrible daemon who captured you has the worst in store for you: dragging you out of your cage with its claws, the creature reaps your soul out of the body and feasts upon it.
Hhhhhhhhh!!!
The host of daemons emerges from the aether, ready to follow your lead and scourge the lands of the mortals.
March!
Your daemonic forces disband, dragged back into the Realms of Chaos.

You're challenge has been issued and so it echoes across the plains: you will organize a great tournament to please Khorne and gain his favour. Any who believes himself worthy of the gaze of Skull God will gather and you will all fight and bleed and kill until only one remains to bask in the triumph of ultimate victory!
BLOOD FOR THE BLOOD GOD!
It's been a long journey, but you're finally back home. A great challenge for Khorne can only be organized every so often, it'll be decades before another one may be issued.
I'll just kill in some other way!

I challenge you, scum!
 I call upon you to shed blood in name of Khorne! Meet me and any others who will heed this call at the plains and face my wrath! Only the strongest will survive to bask in the glory of Lord of Skulls!!

 [From.GetTitledFirstName]
I'll rip your heart OUT!!
You're not worthy of my blade.

You miserable worm!
 Ready yourself to depart from this world! Before the next moon the Bloodletters will feast upon your wretched soul as I claim my rightful place at Khorne's side!

[From.GetTitledFirstName]
Ah!

The boasts of the weak do not concern me,
 shriek and batter your chest won't make you a worthy adversary to fell with my blade.

  [From.GetTitledFirstName]
Coward!

Several warriors have answered to your call, gathering in the barren plain chosen for the deadly tournament in honor of the Lord of Skulls. Not all are challengers, the word of the great bloodbath caught the attention of many aspiring champions, wanderers, curious and traders.\n Once you and the other challengers are reunited, all of the other followers surround you, looking towards you in anticipation.\n Above them, the tattered tabards with Khorne's rune blow in a hot wind, their poles already surrounded by little offerings.

Not enough warriors came at your call. The plain lies empty before you, with just some curious cultists roaming around, squabbling over minor quarrels. You've waited for a few days now and it is certain no one else will come.\n It is with great regret that you announce you are forced to cancel the tournament.
BlOOD! BLOOD AND SKULLS!!
This was a waste of time…

Several warriors have answered [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s call, gathering in the barren plain chosen for the deadly tournament in honor of the Lord of Skulls. Not all are challengers, the word of the great bloodbath caught the attention of many aspiring champions, wanderers, curious and traders.\n Once you and the other challengers are reunited, all of the other followers surround you, looking towards you in anticipation.\n Above them, the tattered tabards with Khorne's rune blow in a hot wind, their poles already surrounded by little offerings.
BlOOD! BLOOD AND SKULLS!!
As the first challenger it is only right that you have the honor of starting the deathmatch. Khorne only favours the ruthless and the strong.
Glory to Khorne! Face me!

It is your turn to fight for the glory of Khorne and yourself. You walk towards the centre of the plain, accompanied by the cheering of the cultists sitting and standing in the field around you. [From.GetFirstName], your adversary, comes from the opposite side to meet you in the middle. You roar and clash your weapons on your armors, before charging each other.
DIE!!!

It is your turn to fight for the glory of Khorne and yourself. You walk towards the centre of the plain, accompanied by the cheering of the cultists sitting and standing in the field around you. [From.GetFirstName], your adversary, comes from the opposite side to meet you in the middle. You roar and clash your weapons on your armors, before charging each other.
DIE!!!
[From.GetFirstName] was furious to announce that, due to lack of challengers, the tournament will be cancelled.
All this road for nothing!?!

You charge [From.GetFirstName], smashing [From.GetHerHis] armor in with a powerful blow and preparing to cut off [From.GetHerHis] head with your blade as [From.GetSheHe] laid on the ground, but [From.GetFirstName] manages to dodge your attack, rolling on the side and tripping you with a kick. Your opponent gets back on [From.GetHerHis] feet, charging in, waving [From.GetHerHis] weapon towards you, but you manage to take advantage of [From.GetHerHis] recklessness and plunge your blade through [From.GetHerHis] neck.

[From.GetFirstName] draws the first blood, cutting a long red line on your arm with [From.GetHerHis] blade and pushing you away with [From.GetHerHis] shield before you could counterattack. Your opponent licks off the blood from [From.GetHerHis] weapon and charges again. You clash your blades several times, taunting and grunting, but, when you finally start to tire your arm, you manage to get an opening and cut through [From.GetHerHis] chest.

You ram into [From.GetFirstName], rising [From.GetHerHim] over your head and tossing [From.GetHerHim] away, then you run to recover your weapon while [From.GetSheHe] tries to get back on [From.GetHerHis] feet. \n Your opponent growls something, bashing [From.GetHerHis] blade on [From.GetHerHis] shield. When you reach [From.GetHerHim] [From.GetSheHe] swings the blade to chop your head off, but you're fast enough to drop on your knees and slice [From.GetHerHim] from belly to neck.

You charge [FromFrom.GetFirstName], smashing [FromFrom.GetHerHis] armor in with a powerful blow and preparing to cut off [FromFrom.GetHerHis] head with your blade as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] laid on the ground, but [FromFrom.GetFirstName] manages to dodge your attack, rolling on the side and tripping you with a kick. Your opponent gets back on [FromFrom.GetHerHis] feet, charging in, waving [FromFrom.GetHerHis] weapon towards you, but you manage to take advantage of [FromFrom.GetHerHis] recklessness and plunge your blade through [FromFrom.GetHerHis] neck.

[FromFrom.GetFirstName] draws the first blood, cutting a long red line on your arm with [FromFrom.GetHerHis] blade and pushing you away with [FromFrom.GetHerHis] shield before you could counterattack. Your opponent licks off the blood from [FromFrom.GetHerHis] weapon and charges again. You clash your blades several times, taunting and grunting, but, when you finally start to tire your arm, you manage to get an opening and cut through [FromFrom.GetHerHis] chest.

You ram into [FromFrom.GetFirstName], rising [FromFrom.GetHerHim] over your head and tossing [FromFrom.GetHerHim] away, then you run to recover your weapon while [FromFrom.GetSheHe] tries to get back on [FromFrom.GetHerHis] feet. \n Your opponent growls something, bashing [FromFrom.GetHerHis] blade on [FromFrom.GetHerHis] shield. When you reach [FromFrom.GetHerHim] [FromFrom.GetSheHe] swings the blade to chop your head off, but you're fast enough to drop on your knees and slice [FromFrom.GetHerHim] from belly to neck.

You exchange swings and blows with your adversary for what seems hours, each of you shouting insults to the other. [From.GetFirstName] finally manages to break the stall by feinting a thrust and then ramming on you with [From.GetHerHis] shoulder. You drag [From.GetHerHim] on the ground as well, starting to punch and bite [From.GetHerHim], until your teeth finally grab hold of [From.GetHerHis] neck and tear it open.

You start the duel confident of your abilities, but you soon realize your opponent is tougher than [From.GetSheHe] appears. [From.GetFirstName] quickly overcomes you, striking you down, dragging you by the neck for all to see, shouting [From.GetHerHis] victory.\n Your shame channels anger even more and you finally find the strength to free yourself of [From.GetHerHis] hold and start choking [From.GetHerHim]. [From.GetFirstName] struggles, but it is of no avail to [From.GetHerHim] and soon falls dead on the ground.

A timely charge allows you to push down your opponent at the start of the duel. You jump on [From.GetFirstName], painfully crushing [From.GetHerHis] knees and cutting a gash under [From.GetHerHis] arm.\n Your opponent screams, but [From.GetSheHe] will not admit defeat. Rolling on the side, [From.GetSheHe] throws [From.GetHerHis] weapon at you, striking you on the shoulder. Limping back on [From.GetHerHis] uninjured leg, [From.GetSheHe] tries to tackle you from below, but you're quicker to plunge your blade into [From.GetHerHis] spine.

Your last strike is so hard, you cut [From.GetFirstName]'s weapon in half. Shouting your imminent triumph, you advance as [From.GetSheHe] retreats.\n You need to accuse [From.GetHerHim] of cowardice several times before [From.GetSheHe] finally stops running and faces you again.\n Using [From.GetHerHis] arms to shield [From.GetHerHim]self, [From.GetSheHe] throws [From.GetHerHis]self at you, ignoring your blows, but soon enough you've hacked [From.GetHerHim] to pieces.

You exchange swings and blows with your adversary for what seems hours, each of you shouting insults to the other. [FromFrom.GetFirstName] finally manages to break the stall by feinting a thrust and then ramming on you with [FromFrom.GetHerHis] shoulder. You drag [FromFrom.GetHerHim] on the ground as well, starting to punch and bite [FromFrom.GetHerHim], until your teeth finally grab hold of [FromFrom.GetHerHis] neck and tear it open.

Limping back on [FromFrom.GetHerHis] uninjured leg, [FromFrom.GetSheHe] tries to tackle you from below, but you're quicker to plunge your blade into [FromFrom.GetHerHis] spine.

Your last strike is so hard, you cut [FromFrom.GetFirstName]'s weapon in half. Shouting your imminent triumph, you advance as [From.GetSheHe] retreats.\n You need to accuse [FromFrom.GetHerHim] of cowardice several times before [FromFrom.GetSheHe] finally stops running and faces you again.\n Using [FromFrom.GetHerHis] arms to shield [FromFrom.GetHerHim]self, [FromFrom.GetSheHe] throws [FromFrom.GetHerHis]self at you, ignoring your blows, but soon enough you've hacked [FromFrom.GetHerHim] to pieces.

The cheering of the crowd inhebriates you as you strike and kick your opponent on the ground. The duel might end sooner than you thought, [From.GetFirstName] was easy to disarm and cut down.\n Yet, as you prepare to end [From.GetHerHis] sufferings, [From.GetSheHe] rises up suddenly, stopping your blade with [From.GetHerHis] bare hands and headbutting you. You're almost about to lose grip of your weapon in the commotion, but you manage to hold tight and move forward, making [From.GetHerHim] impale [From.GetHerHim]self.

You both lost your weapons during the fight, but that didn't stop you from continuing, grappling and wrestling on the ground.\n [From.GetFirstName] tries to break your neck, but you pierce [From.GetHerHis] eye with a nail, breaking [From.GetHerHis] hold on you. You force [From.GetHerHim] down, punching repeadetly [From.GetHerHim] in the head until it's reduced into a bloody pulp.

When [From.GetFirstName] manages to strike you and draw first blood with a lucky swing, you feel the rage building up inside you. Charging your opponent head-on, you parry [From.GetHerHis] second strike and trample [From.GetHerHim]. \n Before [From.GetSheHe] can get up, you come down on [From.GetHerHim] starting to bit off pieces of [From.GetHerHim].\n [From.GetFirstName] tries to push you back, but it's all for naught and soon you've bled [From.GetHerHim] dry.

[From.GetFirstName] is the first to attack, waving [From.GetHerHis] blade to force you in defence, you dodge and deflect [From.GetHerHis] attacks as fast as you can, ignoring the small cuts and trying to wait for [From.GetHerHim] to lose [From.GetHerHis] thrust.\n Finally, you see an opening and strike, passing your blade through [From.GetHerHis] chest and smashing [From.GetHerHis] mouth with a punch.

The cheering of the crowd inhebriates you as you strike and kick your opponent on the ground. The duel might end sooner than you thought, [FromFrom.GetFirstName] was easy to disarm and cut down.\n Yet, as you prepare to end [FromFrom.GetHerHis] sufferings, [FromFrom.GetSheHe] rises up suddenly, stopping your blade with [FromFrom.GetHerHis] bare hands and headbutting you. You're almost about to lose grip of your weapon in the commotion, but you manage to hold tight and move forward, making [FromFrom.GetHerHim] impale [FromFrom.GetHerHim]self.

You force [FromFrom.GetHerHim] down, punching repeadetly [FromFrom.GetHerHim] in the head until it's reduced into a bloody pulp.
