Even the high peaks and plateaus are blanketed, and it is said that arboreal creatures can cross the entire continent without once stepping upon the ground. In places, the trees soar many hundreds of feet in the air and some are even older than the race of humans.
Remove recent_sleep_change flag.

The vast majority of Lustria is covered in jungle so thick that its many levels of canopy block out the sky. Even the high peaks and plateaus are blanketed, and it is said that arboreal creatures can cross the entire continent without once stepping upon the ground. In places, the trees soar many hundreds of feet in the air and some are even older than the race of humans.

Keeping the dense jungle of Lustria at bay is a constant and dangerous struggle. The jungle expands with unnatural speed, and unless it is regularly cut back by burning and felling trees, it will soon overwhelm any settlement, even those of the Lizardmen - but the workers are at constant risk of being killed by animal and plant alike. Who shall fulfil this thankless duty today?
I shall do it myself.
It is the Steward's duty.
Maybe not this time.

The province where the jungle is to be cut back is decided by the location of your [Root.GetTreasurerName] [Root.job_treasurer.GetBestName]. However, [Root.job_treasurer.GetSheHe] is currently in [Root.job_treasurer.Location.GetName], which is not one of your demesne province, or you have been cutting back the jungle recently there.

You have spent the past months burning and cutting the jungle of [FromFrom.GetName]. It was dangerous work - the beasts of the jungle have fought back with ferocity, and the plantlife itself seems to have become more dangerous. But have you been successful?
DEBUG: This event puts you in the FROM scope for Lustrian jungle cut-backing.
DEBUG: Kill creature after duel, even if it lives.
DEBUG: Creature sends challenge.
DEBUG: Province ping event for Lustrian jungle-cutbacking.
[From.GetBestName] reports that the jungle in [FromFromFromFrom.GetName] has been successfully contained.
Despite my best efforts, I've been unable to bring the jungle in [FromFromFrom.GetName] under control.
Your efforts are rewarded with success: life in [FromFromFrom.GetName] is now a bit easier.
Your efforts have been in vain: even after months of work, the jungle of [FromFromFrom.GetName] will not yield to you.
The jungles of Lustria are ever a danger to civilization. For reasons unknown, the creatures of the jungle have gathered into a mighty stampede, threatening to destroy all that lies in their path.
§Y[From.GetBestName]§! has been killed by rampaging reptiles.
Working in the jungle for months on end is a hazardous occupation - even when its dangerous creatures are avoided, sickness and death lurk at every corner.
[GetRandomGodNameCap] be praised!

Precious insights into the Old One's Great Plan have been preserved on the ancient plaques of the Lizardmen, but many have been lost over the millennia. However, on rare occasions they might be recovered from an ancient ruin or lost temple.

The giant reptiles of the jungle are not just a danger for civilized life, but also powerful beasts of war. The jungle is strong right now, and your subjects have managed to tame a number of the wild beasts and ready them for battle.
The jungle is dangerous, but also home to many precious things. Exotic woods and rare medicinal plants can be found there, if one knows where to search.
As the rampaging beasts overcome the defenses of [Root.Location.GetName], you find yourself cornered against a wall. What remains of you is hardly enough for a burial.
The jungles of Lustria are ever a danger to civilization. For reasons unknown, the creatures of the jungle have gathered into a mighty stampede, threatening to destroy all that lies in their path.
Monsters from the jungle have overrun [FromFrom.GetBaseName]. The jungle has expanded even further.
Some years have passed since the last change
Return of the Chameleon Skinks

Long ago, in the time when Chaos came to the world, Oxyotl was one of the rarest breeds of Skink: a Chameleon who could control the colour of his scales at will. He and his band defended Mage-Lord Pocaxalan in his last-ditch effort to save the city with a great spell. But alas, the fickle powers of Chaos tricked Pocaxalan, and he tapped too deeply into the howling Winds of Magic —  The Slann and his last protectors were sucked into the Realm of Chaos.\n\nNo more Chameleon Skinks spawned after the disappearance of Oxyotl. Now, somehow, he has returned from the Realm of Chaos, and the Chameleons have begun to appear again. Chameleon Skinks do not dwell within the temple-cities, but instead strike out deep into the Lustrian jungles. During invasions or times of war, they appear to put themselves at the disposal of the Skink Chiefs.
Have [Root.sleep_level.GetValue] Piety (100 per level of Sleep)
This event should be hidden.

One of your enemies has been foolish enough to try and destroy you. Their actions may have incapacitated you, for a time, but the ancient magic protecting your soul is already at work to bring you back into the land of the living.

One of your enemies has been foolish enough to try and destroy you. Their actions may have incapacitated you, for a time, but the ancient magic protecting your soul is already at work to return you to your full strength.
I will rise again!
Nothing can kill me!
Through the spells of the Liche Priests and your divine willpower, you've returned, your dessicated body whole again, ready to cast dominion across all that you see.
Through the spells of your sorceresses and your own willpower, you've returned, your body whole again, ready to cast dominion across all that you see.
Rise, my soldiers!
At last, vengeance shall be mine!!
Your soldiers have returned with rich treasures from the ancient tombs of Nehekhara. Though there was resistance from the local undead, your expedition has bore some results.
All mine!
The blasphemous raiders of [From.GetTitledFirstName] have dared to scour your lands, stealing the ancient treasure hidden within the ancient halls of your glorious palaces.
Revenge!!
The blasphemous raiders of [From.GetTitledFirstName] have dared to scour [FromFrom.GetName], stealing the ancient treasure hidden within your own palaces.
Revenge!!
[From.GetName] was hiding a marvellous treasure. Scouring the desert allowed your men to return with loads gold, relics and precious stones.
All mine!
The accursed Tomb Kings of Nehekhara have cursed you for desecrating their tombs. Your army is faltering, crumbling under the arcane sickness bestowed unto them, as are your very limbs.
No! Put it back! Put it back!
You've suffered for too long as a prisoner of this unworthy mortal. Though your body may be tied and your servants far away, your wrath shall strike your jailer and punish them for their blasphemy.
So it shall be.
You thought you could lock away an immortal King of Nehekhara with impunity, but [From.GetSheHe] has cast ruination upon you, greying your skin and rotting the bones beneath your flesh.
Nooo!!

One of the pretenders has tried to lock you away, far from the throne that rightfully belongs to you. But there are still many servants you could reach with your mind. Slowly, your retainers made their way to your dungeon and allowed you to escape.
Free at last.

The pretender you decided to lock away has managed to call upon [From.GetHerHis] loyal servants and found a way to sneak away from your dungeons, to plot [From.GetHerHis] campaign for Nehekhara once more.
Bah!
The Nehekkan tribes in [Root.GetName] will no longer stand for your oppressive rule and have decided to rise up against you.
Useless vagrants!
The Nehekkan tribes in [From.GetName] will no longer stand for your oppressive rule and have decided to rise up against your vassal.
Useless vagrants!
A Nehekkan tribe has sent word to ask permission to freely roam within the province of [Root.GetName].
They are free to stay.
I won't allow this.
No vagrant shall ever put foot in this province for as long as I rule.
Emissaries from the tribe of desert dwellers you allowed inside [Root.GetName] have been sent to your court, asking for supplies in a period of shortage for their chiefs.
Just settle down in this land.
We can spare something.
Get lost, you filthy beggars!

For weeks you've received complaints from your subjects regarding the undead troops roaming across your lands on your liege's command. There has been no attack, but the people are unsettled by the skeletons standing sometimes for days, staring at their homes.
I'll talk with their master.
Just pretend they're not there.

Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] has sent a complaint about your troops. Apparently the glorious armies of Nehekhara stationed to protect [From.GetHerHis] province are unsettling the locals.
I command them to fall back and change their path.
I command them to reassure the locals of their good intentions.
This is no concern of us.

Luckily [From.GetTitledFirstName] seems to understand the problem and has had [From.GetHerHis] undead troops discretely fall back, pursuing less exposed patrols, hopefully placating the fears of the living.
Good to hear.
Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] has sent an envoy to thank you for your wisdom regarding the issue of your troops scaring [From.GetHerHis] subjects.
I still don't see what was scary about them.

Unfortunately, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has ruled otherwise on your plea to retreat some of the undead from your countryside. In fact, there are now frequent reports of people scared away from the province by skeletons trying to speak with them in hissing voices and dead languages.
What are they doing?!

Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] is still unsatisfied with your solution to the problem of the craven subjects in [From.GetHerHis] provinces. The living keep on mistrusting and shying away, despite your servants' attempts at reassuring them.
Are they hiding something?

You thought the worst when receiving news of the undead approaching directly your subjects, but, astonishingly enough, your people managed to find common ground with the creatures and are starting to get along fine with each other, trusting the immortal soldiers to be ever-watchful over their land and possessions.
Who'd have thought?
Just as you assumed, it was only a question of showing the integrity and discipline of Nehekharan troops to reassure the people under [From.GetTitledFirstName].
It's obvious.
The response of [From.GetTitledFirstName] was the same as that of [From.GetHerHis] soldier: silence. You keep on receiving complaints about your subjects, but there's not really much you can do.
Why they have to be so creepy?
Your vassal finally stopped with [From.GetHerHis] meaningless complaints about your soldiers scaring the local populace. After all, if they've done nothing wrong, what do they have to fear about?
Indeed.

Since you can remember you've heard incredible and terrible stories about your liege lord and the palace of immortal corpses they live in. Now that there's an opportunity to travel there, you're not sure you want to.
I'm not scared!
Maybe when I'm older...

Amongst the visitors from the lands of the living under your rule, you've been surprised to see a strange creature. Although covered in flesh, it is smaller than any being you remember, be it human, dwarf or halfling, with short limbs and big eyes.
I shall speak with [From.GetHerHim].
A creature so small has to be meaningless.

The tall and dessicated undead, wrapped in golden robes, is finally in front of you and starts speaking in a strange and hissing voice, despite [From.GetHerHis] mouth hanging still. The creature leans forward, as if [From.GetSheHe] was about to grab you.
H-Hello! How do you do?
*Fight back!*
*Flee*

Not only you discovered to your surprise that the creature is in fact your vassal, [From.GetSheHe] explained you that [From.GetSheHe] is a child, that's why [From.GetSheHe] is so small. That still sounds strange, you don't remember ever being like that, even when alive.
At least [From.GetSheHe] can talk properly.
In the end the undead just wanted to talk with you, [From.GetSheHe] didn't mean any harm and looked just surprised to know you are a kid.
Just for now, though!
The creature was more dangerous than you realized. When you tried to approach it and see what it was, it screamed something and attacked you, shortly after running away with one of your sacred ribs.
Come back here!
The undead guards are still looking for you, but you think they'll be more busy recovering the trophy you snatched from [From.GetHerHis] ribcage to worry about you getting out of this tomb.
I still showed [From.GetHerHim]!
At your very sight the little creature started twitching and, before you could even say something, it was running away, screaming with an high-pitched voice.
What the...?
Luckily, you managed to save yourself from the evil undead before it could suck your soul. You'll never return to this cursed tomb.
Never!
Don't know why, maybe because of the lack of eyes, but the undead lord has ignored you for all the time you've been in [From.GetHerHis] palace.
Maybe it's for the best.
You've suffered a great shortage of water this year, with many oasis running low or dry. You've tried to plead to your undead overlords, but they've been silent for the most part.
I'll ask directly to my liege.
It's no use.

You've received word from one of your Nehekkan vassals. [From.GetTitledFirstName] for some strange reason is asking for a great deal of water for [From.GetHerHim]self and [From.GetHerHis] subjects. You do remember water had no flavour for the living either, so you're not sure why [From.GetSheHe] would need any...
If they want to damp themselves, let them.
This is nonsense.
Fortunately your liege has seen the desperate needs of your tribe and has sent some of [From.GetHerHis] servants to gather water for your subjects.
The gods be praised!
Unfortunately your liege has been as silent as [From.GetHerHis] servants and refused to give any help in the search for water.
We'll find something eventually...

You remember enjoying being at a table with friends, partaking in the fruits of the land, when you were alive. Yet all food tastes like ash and all wine like sand. There's no pleasure in feasting and no joy in conversation. Your servants are silent and empty, your lords envious pretenders of past and future generations.
I hate this!
This is just too sad...

You still have some memories of the days when you were alive, the anger, the passion... Yet all is still and cold now. You rule jointly with another pretender, maybe your new wife could be interested in trying to relive what was like to love a man, however rotten be his corpse?

You still have some memories of the days when you were alive, the anger, the passion... Yet all is still and cold now. You rule jointly with another pretender, maybe your new husband could be interested in trying to relive what was like to love a woman, however rotten be her corpse?
Worth a try.
It doesn't matter. I'm past that.

For some weeks now the pretender you decided to rule along with has started making some strange pressures. You're unsure what could be achieved: besides hardly remembering what's supposed to be done, you're pretty sure whatever you would need are rotting in a canopic jar who knows where...

For some weeks now the pretender you decided to rule along with has started making some strange pressures. You're unsure what could be achieved: besides hardly remembering what's supposed to be done, the embalmed and desiccated corpse you 'live' with is not the most inviting creature you'd want to touch.
Let's give it a try.
We're beyond this.
Despite your best efforts, your spouse doesn't seem to be interested in the least in exploring the old boundaries of marriage.
Despite your best efforts, your spouse doesn't seem to be interested in the least in exploring the old boundaries of marriage.
Why not?! Can we not feel alive again?
You were glad to hear your [GetFromRelation] shares in your curiosity and is eager to try alongside you.
You were glad to hear your [GetFromRelation] shares in your curiosity and is eager to try alongside you.
Let's get started!

Your [GetFromRelation] tried his best, but there was not much to go around with in the first place. A lot of awkward rattling and creaking, faked hissing wailing and dead emotionless gazes. Maybe it wasn't such a great idea...

Your [GetFromRelation] tried his best, but there was not much to go around with in the first place. A lot of awkward rattling and creaking, faked hissing wailing and dead emotionless gazes. Maybe it wasn't such a great idea...
Ugh...

Your [GetFromRelation] tried [From.GetHerHis] best, but there was not much to go around with in the first place. A lot of awkward rattling and creaking, faked hissing wailing and dead emotionless gazes. Maybe it wasn't such a great idea...

Your [GetFromRelation] tried [From.GetHerHis] best, but there was not much to go around with in the first place. A lot of awkward rattling and creaking, faked hissing wailing and dead emotionless gazes. Maybe it wasn't such a great idea...
Ugh...

After last night, whatever memory was left of your past life's sexual experience has gone. In its place a disturbing cacophony of creaking joints, bones and desiccated flesh rubbing on each other and lipless mouths clashing together.

After last night, whatever memory was left of your past life's sexual experience has gone. In its place a disgusting cacophony of creaking joints, bones and desiccated flesh rubbing on each other and lipless mouths clashing together.
I could puke if I still had a stomach.

After last night, whatever memory was left of your past life's sexual experience has gone. In its place a disgusting cacophony of creaking joints, bones and desiccated flesh rubbing on each other and lipless mouths clashing together.

After last night, whatever memory was left of your past life's sexual experience has gone. In its place a disgusting cacophony of creaking joints, bones and desiccated flesh rubbing on each other and lipless mouths clashing together.
I could puke if I still had a stomach.

You're not sure if what you did with your [GetFromRelation] last night was exactly how the living do. You had to get more imaginative to make up for the missing body parts, but still, it was not bad at all.

You're not sure if what you did with your [GetFromRelation] last night was exactly how the living do. You had to get more imaginative to make up for the missing body parts, but still, it was not bad at all.
We should try again sometime.

You're not sure if what you did with your [GetFromRelation] last night was exactly how the living do. You had to get more imaginative to make up for the missing body parts, but still, it was not bad at all.

You're not sure if what you did with your [GetFromRelation] last night was exactly how the living do. You had to get more imaginative to make up for the missing body parts, but still, it was not bad at all.
We should try again sometime.
Incantation of Awakening

You have roused your faithful Liche Priests in hopes of awakening one of your Ancestors, and as they are preparing for the ritual you have been left to wander which Ancestor should you Awaken from their Eternal Slumber...
Incantation of Awakening has been completed for [new_tomb_king.GetFirstName] of the House [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName]
Awaken my Gracious Father
Awaken my Despotic Father
Awaken my Scheming Father
Awaken my Majestic Father
Awaken my Indomitable Ancestor
Awaken my Gracious Grandfather
Awaken my Tyrannical Grandfather
Awaken my Scheming Grandfather
Awaken my Honorable Grandfather
Awaken one of my Diplomatic Relatives
Awaken one of my Militant Relatives
Awaken one of my Clever Relatives
Awaken one of my Relatives
Glory to Our Eternal Dynasty!

You are one of the tomb kings of Nehekhara, a powerful ruler of a long-dead realm whose glories have long since faded. Yet still you endure, still you stand guard over the ancient glories of the past, and perhaps - the future glories yet to come.
I serve forever, even in death.

You are one of the Liche Priests of Nehekhara, a powerful priest watching over the Tomb Kings and their treasures. Your oath compels you to serve eternally, even in death, to advance the desires of your immortal god-kings.

Your dynasty stretches back thousands of years, but most of the ancient kings and queens of your line are asleep in their great tombs. It is time to awaken some of them, so that if you should perish, they can take up the rule of your lands.
You recieve news that a massive white whale has been sinking your whaling vessels and is disrupting your trade with the other Norscan tribes!
Your men ready the longboats, loading them with spears and harpoons. Hopefully it will be enough to kill the beast.
We shall hunt the beast down! Ready the longboats!
Call back our remaining whaling vessels.
You send out word that all remaining whaling vessels are to return to the village immediately. Hopefully the beast will lose interest and wander off.
You Set sail out onto the open ocean
Set sail
todo
There is no honor in retreat.
Wolf Hunt
Word has reach you that a pack of wolves are terrorizing a local village, so the freemen demand that you uphold your oath and drive them off.
Ready my hunters!
I do this alone.
Let the rabble handle it.
Strange Tidings

Early in the morning, you and a band of your closest warriors are hunting a stag, along the way you stumble upon an idol to Tchar. Your companions are scouting ahead of you when the idol begins speaking to you, promising absolute power and dominion over all others, if you only worship him...
Tchar is known to be a trickster...
I shall be a willing servant to Tchar, Changer of Ways!
Bloody Visions

Lately, you've noticed yourself becoming more and more aggressive, and constantly craving for battle and glory. Your slumber is disturbed when Kharneth, the Blood God, demands that you join his ranks, and forever live in glory.
Glory in battle is a fine thing, but I shall earn it myself.
Yes... Yes! Blood for the Blood God!
Beautiful Voices

You are walking through your hall during a slow day. After participating in a great feast and round of drinking that would make a legendary tale in itself, you still feel empty inside, like something is missing. Soon, you begin hearing voices, beautiful ones, calling to you, asking you to give yourself to Shornaal so that you may be satisfied...
And end up a decadent sluggard? I think not!
More... More of everything!
Decay and Ruin

In your dreams Nurgleth, Lord of Death and Decay calls to you... 'The world is falling, it is corrupt, dying... embrace it, my child... embrace your destiny...' you hear a voice calling, and maggots crawl up from the ground, greeting you...
Wreck and ruin to Nurgleth, I shall make my own way!
May the corpse trail grow long!
True Evil

In your dreams, spirits of all shapes and forms come to you... You recognise many of them, and they press on you, whispering forbidden secrets and promises of power. They demand that you cast off the deities and guardians that have guided you your whole life and devote yourself entirely to the real gods of this world, the Dark Gods of Chaos Undivided: Khorne, Nurgle, Tzeentch & Slaanesh.
My oaths to my kin and my gods are too important to betray!
For the Ruinous Powers!
You have decided to abandon the traditional gods of the Norscan faith, as they have done little for you, in favour of the Chaos Gods, which shall you follow?
You have decided to choose to dedicate yourself to one of the main chaos gods, as general worship seems to have done little for you, in favour of the Chaos Gods, which shall you follow?
All of them, for the Dark Gods! For Chaos!
I feel a rage unequalled in the mortal realm... Blood for the Blood God!
Slaanesh will grant me my desires.
There are others...
Here are the others
This world reeks of death, Nurgle will see me safe.
Everyone is out to get me, but Tzeentch shall show me the way.
Nevermind.
Convert to Chaos
Embrace the Dark gods
Become Chaos Horde
adopt the ways of the Kurgan and Hung.
Conversion
All holdings will be destroyed, providing gold and population to your horde, a Herdstone will be added to your new Nomadic capital.
All holdings will be destroyed, providing gold and population to your horde, some tribal buildings we be repurposed and added to your new Nomadic capital.
Choose a patron god
We pay homage to many gods... I would surely benefit by choosing one as my patron.
We Norscans worship many gods, perhaps we should adopt a single one as our patron and enjoy benefits?
Promote Tchar
Promote Kjörn
Promote Nierg
There are others...
Here are the others.
Promote Loesh
Promote Olric
Promote Órsen
On second thought...
Patron of Tchar
Patron of Kjörn
Patron of Nierg
Patron of Loesh
Patron of Olric
Patron of Órsen
Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] seems to be growing to be quite the plump ogre.
Good.
Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] is eating less then expected. If [From.GetSheHe] continues like this, [From.GetSheHe]'ll be a laughing stock for the tribe.
This will NOT stand!
Worse for [From.GetHerHim].

Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] has not taken well your resistence to hunger. After a good beating, [From.GetSheHe] has started to force you to take your daily portion of meat and then some.
Bleah!
You've spent a good childhood, taking always as much food as you could and now it well shows as you are one of the largest ogres of your tribe, tough and intimidating.

You might have had some hit and miss during your childhood, but you've certainly tried your best taking as much food as you could. If nothing else, you've certainly grown to be an ogre of a respectable size.
You didn't care much for appeasing your own hunger, letting other children of the tribe taking the best meat and now it shows. Many in the tribe push you around and laugh at your weakly constitution.
As it should be!
Bah…
Ogre Chieftains are respected for the girth of their belly. As you are of a relatively weak constitution, many of your warriors have come to believe you not to be the better choice for a leader.
They're wrong!
You take the puny [From.GetFirstName] between your arms and start savagely taking chomps off of the poor screaming creature until only a few polished bones remain.
*Burp*

The plundering and looting undertaken by your fleets has earned you a reputation as a fearsome pirate. All along the seas of the world, mothers tucking their children in for the night warn that unless they behave, the terrible Captain [Root.GetFirstName], scourge of the seven seas, will come ashore with [Root.GetHerHis] dire seadogs and take them away.
column3: Les pillages commis en votre nom vous ont valu une réputation de redoutable razzieur fer-né. Tout le long des côtes de Westeros, les mères bordent leurs enfants le soir en leur disant que s'ils ne sont pas sages, le terrible [Root.GetFirstName], le fléau des mers, débarquera avec ses guerriers morts-vivants pour les manger.
column4: Das Brandschatzen und Plündern in Eurem Namen hat Euch den Ruf eines furchtlosen Wikinger-Räubers eingebracht. An allen Küsten Europas bringen Mütter ihre Kinder abends zu Bett und flüstern Warnungen, dass der Schrecken [Root.GetFirstName], die Geißel der Meere, mit seinen untoten Kriegern kommen und sie fressen wird, wenn sie sich nicht benehmen.
column6: El pillaje y el saqueo llevado a cabo en tu nombre te ha dado una reputación de temible asaltante Vikingo. A lo largo de las costas de Europa, las madres advierten a sus hijos cuando llega la noche que si no se comportan, el terrible [Root.GetFirstName], castigo de los mares, llegará a tierra con sus guerreros muertos vivientes y se los comerán.

column2: Arrr, mateys!

You were sailing the seas around [Root.Location.GetName], a location known to be targetted by pirates, when a small fleet of ships was spotted sailing for you. The crew quickly realise that is indeed a pirate fleet, but is too late. Your ship is captured, along with all of its crew, and you the biggest prize.
column3: Vous naviguiez à proximité de [Root.Location.GetName], un endroit connu pour être infesté de pirates, lorsque vous avez aperçu une petite flotte de bateaux. L'équipe a très vite réalisé qu'il s'agissait de pirates, mais il était trop tard. Votre navire a été capturé, tout comme son équipage... et vousè-même. Vous êtes sûrement la prise qui a le plus de valeur.

column2: I hope this [From.GetTitle] accepts a ransom
column3: J'espère que [From.GetTitle] acceptera une rançon.

column2: A small flotilla commanded by one of your lesser captains was prowling the seas near [From.Location.GetName] when they came upon a lightly defended ship. The captain reports that the ship and crew were captured without much trouble, and that one particularly noble passenger was found. [From.GetSheHeCap] identifies [From.GetHerHim]self [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName].
column3: Une petite flotille commandée par l'un de vos capitaines rôdait sur les mers près de [From.Location.GetName] lorsqu'elle a rencontré un navire légèrement défendu. Le capitaine dit que le navire et l'équipage ont été capturés sans grandes difficultés et qu'un passage noble s'y trouvait. [From.GetSheHeCap] dit être [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName].

column2: Good work, a most valuable prisoner
column3: Bien joué, une prise de valeur.

column2: We have had reports that a great misfortune has befallen to your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]. [From.GetSheHeCap] had been sailing the seas near [From.Location.GetName] when they were attacked by a flotilla of pirates! [From.GetTitledFirstName] and the crew are now reportedly in the captivity of [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName].
column3: Nous avons reçu de mauvaises nouvelles concernant votre [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]. [From.GetSheHeCap] naviguait près de [From.Location.GetName] lorsque son navire a été attaqué par une flotille pirate ! [From.GetTitledFirstName] et son équipage sont aux mains de [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName].

column2: This [FromFrom.Culture.GetName] menace must be stopped
column3: Cette menace [FromFrom.Culture.GetName] doit cessée.

column2: This child resembles its family - but the subtle differences will determine how others respond to [GetHerHis] appearance.
One can only hope for the best.
As this child begins to feed and grow, you begin to see indications of [GetHerHis] future physical strength and stamina.
May [GetSheHe] become as fit and vigorous as the heroes of old!
As this child interacts with the world, you learn whether or not [GetSheHe] takes after [GetHerHis] parents in mental ability.
Pray [GetSheHe] has learned from [GetHerHis] family even while in the womb.
Melodious
This character has a voice like an angel.
Fluent
This character has a clear and coherent voice.
Resilient
This character is especially resistant to illness.
Psychopath
This character is predisposed to antisocial and violent behaviour.
Frugal
This character dislikes spending their wealth.
Romantic
This character is a hopeless romantic constantly seeking love, often in the worst places.

One of your servants asked you today if he could leave to visit his dying mother before she passed. You refused, showing little concern for his pitiful issues. It seems your troubled childhood has affected your ability to empathize with others.
You are a Psychopath.
